bill_summary: This bill alters the schedule by which Maryland counties and Baltimore City reimburse the State Department of Assessments and Taxation for administrative costs, including real and business personal property valuations and information technology services. It changes the payment structure from four quarterly 25% installments to three installments: 50% due on October 1, 25% on January 1, and 25% on April 1.
responsible_party: State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Maryland counties and Baltimore City

Title: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center - External Data Sharing With Third-Party Data Centers for Multistate Reporting - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governing Board of the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to provide certain student and workforce data to a third-party data center under certain circumstances; requiring each third-party data center to agree to comply with certain requirements relating to the data the center receives; requiring the Center to enter into a written data sharing agreement with certain third-party data centers; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Longitudinal Data System (MLDS) Center to share individual-level student and workforce data with third-party data centers for multistate research and reporting. It establishes strict security and privacy requirements, including FedRAMP certification and the use of de-identified data, while requiring formal data-sharing agreements and annual reviews by the Center's Governing Board. Additionally, it repeals existing specific authorization for sharing data with the U.S. Census Bureau to consolidate it under these new standards.
responsible_party: Governing Board of the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center
stakeholders: Maryland students, workforce members, state educational agencies, and higher education institutions

Title: Personal Property Tax - Exemptions for Low Assessment - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering exemptions from the personal property tax for business personal property that has a total original cost below $20,000 by repealing provisions of law that prohibit the State Department of Assessments and Taxation from collecting information or requiring the submission of a personal property tax return from certain businesses that qualify for the exemptions; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill removes provisions that previously prohibited the State Department of Assessments and Taxation (SDAT) from requiring personal property tax returns or collecting information from businesses and individuals whose personal property has an original cost of less than $20,000. While the property remains exempt from taxation, the bill allows SDAT to require these entities to submit filings or information.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Small businesses and individuals owning business personal property with a total original cost of less than $20,000

Title: Gaming - Prohibition on Interactive Games and Revenue From Illegal Markets
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from operating, conducting, or promoting interactive games; requiring gaming license applicants and license holders to report to the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission annually any business relationship with certain persons known to support, operate, conduct, or promote certain interactive games; requiring the Commission to deny certain license applications and revoke certain licenses under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the operation and promotion of certain interactive games in Maryland and restricts the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission from licensing entities that earn revenue from illegal gaming markets, high-risk jurisdictions, or state sponsors of terrorism. It establishes mandatory reporting requirements for licensees regarding their business relationships and revenue sources while setting criminal penalties for violations.
responsible_party: State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Gaming license applicants and licensees, their business affiliates, and the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission.

Title: Education - Career and Technical Education (CTE) Committee and CTE Skills Standards Advisory Committee - Revisions and Repeal
Synopsis: Altering the purpose, composition, and duties of the Career and Technical Education (CTE) Committee; repealing the CTE Skills Standards Advisory Committee; and requiring State agencies and certain workforce development and education programs to use a certain list of occupations as a guideline for curriculum alignment, credentialing, and career advancement.
bill_summary: This bill alters the structure and responsibilities of the Career and Technical Education (CTE) Committee and repeals the CTE Skills Standards Advisory Committee. It mandates that the CTE Committee, operating within the Governor's Workforce Development Board, develop and maintain a list of high-skill, high-wage, or in-demand priority occupations and create comprehensive career pathway information to guide curriculum alignment and workforce development across Maryland state agencies and education programs.
stakeholders: Maryland public high school and postsecondary students, employers, industry associations, community colleges, and state workforce and education agencies

Title: Adult Education – High School Diploma Pathways – GED Option Pilot Program and MDiplomaWorks Pathway
Synopsis: Establishing the GED Option Pilot Program to expand the GED Option Program to students beyond English language learners to ensure a pathway for students to obtain a high school diploma and prepare for postsecondary education or the workforce; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to establish criteria to select certain local school systems for participation in the Program; establishing the MDiplomaWorks pathway as an alternative method of earning a high school diploma in the State; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes two new pathways for obtaining a high school diploma in Maryland: the GED Option Pilot Program and the MDiplomaWorks pathway. The GED Option Pilot Program expands existing pathways to high school students at risk of not graduating in at least three selected local school systems. The MDiplomaWorks pathway provides a competency-based alternative for individuals to earn a diploma through industry credentials, career and technical education coursework, and on-the-job learning experiences.
stakeholders: Maryland students at risk of not completing high school and adults without a high school diploma

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation – County Supervisor Residency Requirement and Location of County Assessment Offices – Alteration
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that a county supervisor of real property assessments reside in the county for which the supervisor is appointed; and repealing the requirement that the county assessment office be located in the county seat.
bill_summary: This bill removes the requirement that a county supervisor of real property assessments must reside in the county for which they are appointed. It also eliminates the mandate that county assessment offices be located in the county seat, providing flexibility for office placement within the county or Baltimore City.
responsible_party: State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: County supervisors of real property assessments, local county governments, and potential candidates for supervisor positions.

Title: Fraud Prevention, Prevailing Wage, and Living Wage - Prohibitions, Penalties, and Enforcement
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly making or using, or causing to be made or used, a false record or statement resulting in underpayments of unemployment insurance contributions or payment of unemployment insurance benefits of more than $15,000; altering the enforcement mechanisms related to workplace fraud laws, living wage laws, and prevailing wage laws, including authorizing the Attorney General to investigate and bring suit in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: This bill strengthens the enforcement of workplace fraud, prevailing wage, and living wage laws in Maryland. It prohibits false statements concerning unemployment insurance contributions and benefits, and authorizes the Attorney General to investigate and bring civil actions for violations related to misclassification of employees and wage laws. The bill also establishes a mechanism to suspend or revoke professional and occupational licenses for employers who fail to pay penalties or restitution, increases penalties for certain violations, and mandates regular coordination between the Department of Labor and the Attorney General's office.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor (Commissioner of Labor and Industry) and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Maryland workers, employers, contractors, and state licensing authorities

Title: State Contracts - Prohibited Provisions - Exemptions
Synopsis: Exempting certain contracts entered into by the Office of International Trade from certain prohibitions on the provisions that may be included in State contracts.
bill_summary: This bill exempts contracts entered into by the Office of International Trade within the Department of Commerce for international business development from certain legal prohibitions usually applied to State contracts, such as restrictions on indemnity, binding arbitration, and venue selection.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce, Office of International Trade
stakeholders: Maryland Department of Commerce, Office of International Trade, and international businesses or organizations entering into contracts with the State.

Title: Maryland Military Department – Supervision of State Active Duty Personnel
Synopsis: Providing for command and control of State active duty personnel during mobilizations of the Maryland National Guard.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies the command and control structure for members of the Maryland Military Department, including the National Guard and the Maryland Defense Force, during State active duty mobilizations. It stipulates that personnel are under the operational command of the Adjutant General or a designated officer, regardless of whether that officer is in State active duty or a Federal status where the Governor is the Commander in Chief.
responsible_party: The Adjutant General of the Maryland Military Department
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland National Guard, the Maryland Defense Force, and the Maryland Military Department; the Governor of Maryland; and local law enforcement authorities.

Title: Maryland Transportation Authority - Patapsco River Toll Bridge - Design
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Authority to design and locate the entrances, exits, and associated roads of the new bridge over the Patapsco River that will replace the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge to ensure that a vehicle that will not cross the bridge is not required to pay a toll.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Transportation Authority to design and locate the entrances, exits, and associated roads of the new bridge replacing the Francis Scott Key Bridge over the Patapsco River to ensure that any vehicle that does not cross the bridge is not required to pay a toll.
stakeholders: Motorists and drivers using roads near the Patapsco River bridge

Title: Handguns - Wear, Carry, and Transport Laws - Handbook Publication
Synopsis: Requiring, by October 1, 2026, and each October 1 thereafter, the Office of the Attorney General to publish a handbook summarizing State law, federal law, and case law related to wearing, carrying, and transporting a handgun in public in Maryland; and requiring the handbook to be drafted in plain language so it can be easily understood without special knowledge of relevant law and in a format that can be easily used to teach certain required firearms courses.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Office of the Attorney General to publish an annual handbook summarizing state and federal laws, as well as case law, regarding the wearing, carrying, and transporting of handguns in public. The handbook must be written in plain language and formatted so it can be used for firearm safety courses.
stakeholders: Handgun owners, firearm safety course instructors, and individuals seeking to wear, carry, or transport handguns in Maryland.

Title: Public Information Act - Data Manipulation
Synopsis: Establishing that a new public record is not created if, in responding to a certain request under the Public Information Act, a custodian conducts certain data manipulation.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies that when a custodian of public records performs data manipulation—including compilation, extraction, querying, or statistical aggregation—to fulfill a request for a portion of a record in an electronic format, they are not considered to have created a new public record, provided the database program is capable of such functions.
responsible_party: Custodians of public records within Maryland state and local government agencies
stakeholders: Applicants requesting public records and Maryland government agency staff responsible for maintaining and releasing records

Title: Baltimore County - Nuisance Actions - Community Association
Synopsis: Altering the definitions of "community association" and "local code violation" to authorize community associations to seek judicial relief for nuisance abatement in Baltimore County; requiring certain notices relating to nuisance actions to be provided to the county code enforcement agency and certain tenants and property owners; repealing a provision of law requiring a certain court to determine the amount and conditions of a bond filed by a community association in a certain nuisance action; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the process for community associations in Baltimore County to pursue legal action for nuisance abatement. It broadens the definition of 'community association' by removing certain membership and duration requirements, updates the definition of 'local code violation,' mandates specific notice requirements for tenants and property owners, and eliminates the requirement for associations to post a bond when filing a nuisance action.
responsible_party: Circuit Court for Baltimore County and the Baltimore County Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Community associations, residents, property owners, and tenants in Baltimore County

Title: Vehicle Laws - Manufacturers and Dealers - Prices Listed on Dealer Websites (Jack Fitzgerald Price Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Providing that a manufacturer, distributor, or factory branch may not take an adverse action against a dealer for disclosing on its website that the advertised price of a vehicle is the manufacturer's minimum allowable advertised price and that the dealer may offer a lower price for the vehicle.
bill_summary: The Jack Fitzgerald Price Transparency Act prohibits vehicle manufacturers, distributors, or factory branches from taking adverse action against a dealer for stating on its website that an advertised vehicle price is the manufacturer's minimum allowable advertised price and that the dealer may offer a lower price, provided the dealer complies with state advertising laws.
stakeholders: Vehicle dealers, vehicle manufacturers, distributors, factory branches, and vehicle consumers

Title: Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund; requiring the Comptroller to administer the Fund at the direction of the Office of Social Equity; altering requirements for a certain county plan for the distribution of funds from the Fund; requiring a county to consult with the Office to make any adjustments to the county plan; altering the requirements for a certain report on the Fund; requiring the Comptroller, in consultation with the Office, to ensure compliance with provisions of law governing the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: House Bill 307 alters the purpose and administration of the Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund. The bill requires the Comptroller to administer the Fund under the direction of the Office of Social Equity, updates requirements for county-level distribution plans and reporting, and specifies that the Fund must be used to support community-based initiatives and programs in areas disproportionately impacted by cannabis prohibition and enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller and the Office of Social Equity
stakeholders: Residents of geographic areas disproportionately impacted by cannabis law enforcement, low-income communities, community-based organizations, and individuals and families impacted by incarceration.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Principal Offices - Private Mailboxes
Synopsis: Authorizing an address supplied by a commercial mail receiving agency to be designated as the principal office of a Maryland corporation, limited liability company, limited liability partnership, or limited partnership, under certain circumstances; and providing for the disclosure of certain contact information on request by a commercial mail receiving agency.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Maryland corporations, limited liability companies, limited liability partnerships, and limited partnerships to designate an address provided by a commercial mail receiving agency as their principal office address, provided they have a valid agreement. It also requires these commercial mail receiving agencies to provide contact information from USPS Form 1583 to the Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation or law enforcement agencies upon request.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Maryland corporations, limited liability companies, limited liability partnerships, limited partnerships, commercial mail receiving agencies, and law enforcement agencies.

Title: Judicial Facilities - Stops, Detentions, and Arrests - Limitations
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from being stopped, detained, or arrested for certain civil offenses while the individual is in a judicial facility or is traveling within 1 mile of a judicial facility for the purpose of attending a meeting, a hearing, or another official proceeding in the Judicial facility except under certain circumstances; establishing that evidence obtained in violation of the Act is inadmissible in a proceeding over which a State court or State or local agency has jurisdiction; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits law enforcement from stopping, detaining, or arresting individuals for civil offenses in or near judicial facilities while the individual is attending a proceeding, unless prior notice is given to the court and the action is non-disruptive. It renders evidence from illegal stops inadmissible and authorizes civil actions by affected individuals or the Attorney General.
responsible_party: Maryland Attorney General and the Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals attending judicial proceedings, law enforcement agencies, and government agents

Title: Correctional Services - Restrictive Housing - Individuals With Developmental or Intellectual Disabilities
Synopsis: Authorizing an incarcerated individual to undergo a certain assessment at intake at a State correctional facility by a certain clinical professional; authorizing a certain clinical professional to make a certain recommendation about a certain incarcerated individual; and prohibiting a State correctional facility from putting a certain incarcerated individual in restrictive housing for more than 15 consecutive days in a 30-day time period unless the individual commits a certain prohibited act.
bill_summary: This bill regulates the use of restrictive housing for incarcerated individuals in State correctional facilities who have developmental or intellectual disabilities. It allows clinical professionals to assess individuals during intake and recommend they not be held in restrictive housing for more than 15 consecutive days within a 30-day period, a restriction the facility must follow unless the individual commits specific violent or dangerous prohibited acts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals with developmental or intellectual disabilities and staff at Maryland State correctional facilities

Title: Public Schools - Individuals With Disabilities - Accessibility and Emergency Planning
Synopsis: Requiring each local school system to identify, in its regular safety evaluation, issues of accessibility for individuals with disabilities; requiring local school systems to include in a certain confidential annual report instances in which a public school facility became inaccessible for a student with a disability in a manner that could impede evacuations or emergency response; and requiring a certain annual report to be confidential and limiting disclosure of the report to certain individuals.
bill_summary: This bill requires local school systems in Maryland to identify accessibility issues for individuals with disabilities during regular school safety evaluations. It also mandates that annual safety reports include specific instances where school facilities became inaccessible for students with disabilities in ways that could impede evacuation or emergency response. Additionally, the bill establishes that these reports are confidential and exempt from the Maryland Public Information Act, though they may be disclosed to members of the General Assembly upon request.
responsible_party: Maryland local school systems and the Maryland Center for School Safety
stakeholders: Students with disabilities, local school systems, and public school facilities

Title: Correctional Officers' Retirement System - Redeposit of Accumulated Contributions - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing a member of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System to receive certain service credit on the redeposit of contributions from the Employees' Pension System or the Teachers' Pension System.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes members of the Maryland Correctional Officers’ Retirement System to receive service credit for prior periods of employment by redepositing withdrawn accumulated contributions from the Employees’ Pension System or the Teachers’ Pension System into their current account, provided the redeposit is made in a single payment including regular interest.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Correctional Officers’ Retirement System who previously withdrew contributions from the Employees’ Pension System or the Teachers’ Pension System.

Title: Landlord and Tenant - Residential Housing - Rental Applications and Tenant Screening
Synopsis: Prohibiting a landlord from collecting an application fee unless the rental unit is available or will become available within 30 days of receiving the application; requiring a landlord to provide certain written disclosures before accepting an application or screening fee; prohibiting a landlord from taking certain adverse actions against a prospective tenant unless a landlord provides certain written notice to the prospective tenant; prohibiting a landlord from taking certain actions relating to certain records; etc.
bill_summary: This bill regulates the rental application and tenant screening process in Maryland by prohibiting landlords from collecting fees for units that are not currently available or will not be available within 30 days. It requires landlords to provide written disclosures regarding screening criteria and tenant rights, and it prohibits the use of certain court records, such as failure to pay rent proceedings that did not result in a judgment and shielded records, when evaluating applicants. Additionally, the bill allows prospective tenants to dispute information in screening reports and establishes that violations are unfair trade practices subject to enforcement by the Attorney General.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Residential landlords, prospective tenants, and tenant screening service providers

Title: Automation Technology Deployment Assessment and Displaced Employee Retraining Fund - Established
Synopsis: Requiring employers with 100 or more employees that reduced their workforce in the State by a least 10 employees while using automation technology to submit certain information to the Secretary of Labor concerning the number of employees employed, automation technology deployed or used, and certain employees separated from employment during the immediately preceding calendar year; requiring a certain covered employer to pay a certain assessment for each displaced employee reported by the covered employer; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires employers with 100 or more employees to report the deployment of automation technology that leads to a workforce reduction of at least 10 employees. Affected employers must pay a $900 assessment per displaced employee into the newly established Displaced Employee Retraining Fund, which will be used by the Secretary of Labor to fund job training, placement, and other services for workers displaced by automation technologies like AI and robotics.
stakeholders: Workers in Maryland displaced by automation technology and employers in the state with 100 or more employees.

Title: Human Relations - Discrimination in Housing - Income-Based Housing Subsidies
Synopsis: Providing that a certain landlord may not refuse to rent to a prospective tenant who pays rent with the assistance of an income-based housing subsidy under certain circumstances; providing that a certain landlord may collect financial information from a perspective tenant under certain circumstances; and providing that a violation of the Act is a discriminatory housing practice and is subject to enforcement by the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits landlords from refusing to rent to prospective tenants who use income-based housing subsidies, such as Section 8 vouchers, based on their income level, credit score, or certain adverse credit history. It establishes that such actions are discriminatory housing practices and grants the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights authority to enforce these regulations.
stakeholders: Prospective tenants using income-based housing subsidies, landlords, and residential rental property owners

Title: Confidentiality of Medical Records - Definition of Medical Record
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "medical record" for purposes of law governing the confidentiality of medical records to require that certain information be recorded by a health care provider through certain means, instead of entered into the record of a patient or recipient, and to include certain electronic messages.
bill_summary: This bill updates the legal definition of a 'medical record' in Maryland to ensure information recorded by healthcare providers through any medium—including audio, video, and electronic messages—is subject to confidentiality laws. It replaces the narrow requirement that information be specifically entered into a patient's record with a broader definition covering any recorded information that relates to a patient's healthcare and identifies them.
stakeholders: Patients, healthcare recipients, and healthcare providers in Maryland

Title: Recipients of Economic Development Assistance or State Contracts - Certification of Compliance With State Labor Laws
Synopsis: Requiring certain persons that receive certain State economic development assistance to make a certification each year that the person was not the subject of a certain final adverse determination  and is not currently failing to comply with certain outstanding requirements under a prior final judgment or order; requiring a certain unit of State government to initiate a pause on disbursements or approvals of certain economic development assistance or the award or renewal of certain State contracts; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires recipients of at least $100,000 in Maryland state economic development assistance or $250,000 in aggregate state procurement contracts to certify annually that they have complied with state labor laws. Failure to file this certification or having certain labor law violations results in a temporary pause on receiving new disbursements, approvals for assistance, or contract renewals.
responsible_party: Maryland state agencies that administer economic development assistance or procurement contracts, the Board of Public Works, and the Maryland Department of Commerce.
stakeholders: Recipients of at least $100,000 in Maryland state economic development assistance or $250,000 in aggregate state procurement contracts.

Title: Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission and Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission – Vendor Registration PG/MC 107–26
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to accept as a registered vendor any person that is registered through a vendor registration process as a vendor with Montgomery County or Prince George's County; and authorizing the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to enter into certain memoranda of understanding with Montgomery County and Prince George's County.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission (M-NCPPC) and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission (WSSC) to accept as a registered vendor any person or business already registered with Montgomery County or Prince George's County. It also authorizes these commissions to enter into memoranda of understanding with the counties to implement the streamlined vendor registration process.
responsible_party: Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Vendors and businesses registered with Montgomery County or Prince George’s County seeking to do business with the commissions.

Title: County Boards of Education - Student Transportation - Sunset Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date of certain provisions of law that authorize a county board of education to provide transportation to and from school for certain students using a vehicle other than a certain type of school vehicle under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the June 30, 2026, sunset provision of previously enacted laws, thereby making permanent the authority for county boards of education to transport certain students using vehicles other than standard school buses under specific circumstances.
stakeholders: Maryland public school students and county boards of education

Title: Anne Arundel County - Property Tax Credit - Rural Legacy Program

bill_summary: This bill authorizes the governing body of Anne Arundel County to grant a property tax credit for real property located within a Rural Legacy Area, provided the owner has sold the property's development rights under the Rural Legacy Program.
responsible_party: The governing body of Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Property owners in Anne Arundel County who own land in a Rural Legacy Area and have sold their development rights.

Title: Environment - Synthetic Turf Industry and Disposal Study - Deadline Extension
Synopsis: Extending the deadline by which the Department of the Environment is required to submit a certain report on the synthetic turf industry and synthetic turf disposal from July 1, 2026, to January 15, 2027.
bill_summary: This bill extends the deadline for the Maryland Department of the Environment to submit a study and report on the synthetic turf industry and disposal from July 1, 2026, to January 15, 2027. The study must address industry practices, disposal methods, recycling rates, and proposals for improving waste management.
stakeholders: Synthetic turf industry representatives, producers, retailers, local governments, county school systems, higher education facilities, and professional sports organizations

Title: Maryland Health Care Commission - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Health Care Commission by reducing from nine to eight the number of members who are individuals who do not have any connection with the management or policy of a health care provider or payor and including a representative of a hospital; and altering from five to four the number of Commission members who must be residents of different counties with a population of 300,000 or more.
bill_summary: This bill alters the membership of the Maryland Health Care Commission by reducing the number of public members (those with no connection to health care providers or payors) from nine to eight and adding a hospital representative as a professional member. It also modifies the geographic residency requirements for Commission members based on county population thresholds.
stakeholders: Maryland Health Care Commission members, hospital representatives, health care providers, and residents of various Maryland counties.

Title: Income Tax - Credit for Income Taxes and Penalties Due to Financial Exploitation
Synopsis: Allowing a credit against the State income tax for certain income taxes and penalties attributable to an early withdrawal of retirement funds due to financial exploitation; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill allows individuals who were victims of financial exploitation to claim a credit against their Maryland State income tax for taxes and federal penalties paid on early withdrawals from retirement accounts necessitated by that exploitation.
stakeholders: Susceptible adults and older adults who have been victims of financial exploitation and incurred early retirement fund withdrawal penalties.

Title: Family Law - Child Support - Assignment of Rights
Synopsis: Authorizing the Child Support Administration to take action to secure an assignment to the State of any rights to support on behalf of a child receiving foster care maintenance payments; and requiring a court to terminate a child support order that was previously established or assigned for a child receiving a foster care maintenance payment under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill limits the circumstances under which the Maryland Child Support Administration can secure an assignment of child support rights to the State for children receiving foster care maintenance payments. It also requires courts to terminate existing child support orders for these children when the state determines the order is no longer appropriate, without requiring a showing of a material change of circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services (Child Support Administration and Social Services Administration)
stakeholders: Children in the foster care system, parents of children receiving foster care maintenance payments, and the state agencies managing child support and social services.

Title: Education - Maryland Center for School Safety - Anonymous Reporting System
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Center for School Safety to develop and administer an anonymous reporting system to receive information related to a school or student safety concern; requiring the Center to develop operational guidelines and procedures, and to provide training relative to the system; requiring each local school system to participate in the anonymous reporting system, subject to a certain exception; requiring a certain custodian of records to deny inspection of information and materials related the system; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Center for School Safety to develop and manage an anonymous reporting system for safety concerns involving schools or students. Local school systems are required to participate in this system starting July 1, 2027, unless they already operate a substantially similar reporting system. The Center is also tasked with providing training for school personnel and establishing operational procedures for the system.
stakeholders: Maryland students, parents, school personnel, and local school systems

Title: Education - Board of Community College Trustees for Baltimore County - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the number of members on the Board of Community College Trustees for Baltimore County; and altering the membership of the Board to reflect the change in Baltimore County councilmanic districts.
bill_summary: This bill reduces the membership of the Board of Community College Trustees for Baltimore County from 15 members to 11 members. It modifies the board's composition to include two at-large members and one member from each of the nine councilmanic districts in Baltimore County, replacing the previous structure of one at-large member and two members from each of seven districts. The bill also establishes transition procedures for current board members and maintains five-year terms with a two-term limit.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland and the Board of Community College Trustees for Baltimore County
stakeholders: Members of the Board of Community College Trustees for Baltimore County, residents of Baltimore County's councilmanic districts, and the Community College of Baltimore County

Title: Bicounty Commissions - Public Ethics - Financial Disclosure Statements PG/MC 105-26

In Prince George’s County, it shifts the responsibility for receiving, retaining, and managing these statements from the county's chief administrative officer to the Prince George’s County Office of Ethics and Accountability, while establishing specific protocols for public inspection and the return of statements to unsuccessful applicants.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County Office of Ethics and Accountability
stakeholders: Commissioners and applicants for appointment as commissioners of bicounty commissions in Prince George's County and Montgomery County

Title: Criminal Law - School Resource Officers - Prohibition on Sexual Activity with Students

bill_summary: This bill prohibits law enforcement officers who are assigned as school resource officers from engaging in sexual contact, vaginal intercourse, or sexual acts with students enrolled in the school where the officer is assigned. stakeholders: Students enrolled in Maryland schools and law enforcement officers serving as school resource officers

Synopsis: Authorizing the Director of the State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to issue a license to certain persons to conduct certain lottery courier services in the State, subject to certain requirements and limitations; defining "courier service" as the process of delivering a lottery ticket to a purchaser through the online account of a licensed courier; providing that certain contracts between a licensed courier and a State lottery sales agent are not subject to disclosure under the Public Information Act; etc.

Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Dental Examiners to conduct unannounced inspections of the office of certain dentists to determine compliance with certain guidelines for infection control; altering the grounds for discipline of dentists, dental hygienists, and dental and dental hygienist license applicants; and authorizing the Board to take disciplinary action against certified expanded function dental assistants and certificate applicants under certain circumstances.

Synopsis: Authorizing, under certain circumstances, a personal representative to petition the orphans' court to interpret a decedent's will in accordance with the decedent's intent as demonstrated by certain extrinsic evidence; authorizing the personal representative to require a certain legatee to demonstrate the use of a legacy under the decedent's will; requiring the court to interpret a will in a certain manner if certain language is included in the will; etc.

Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Prince George's County to enact a local law to regulate certain procurement activities of the Prince George's County public school system and Prince George's Community College; and requiring certain procurement preference programs for procurements made by the Prince George's County Board of Education or the Board of Community College Trustees for Prince George's County to be subject to certain requirements adopted by the governing body of Prince George's County.

Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law to include physician assistants in the health care practitioners who may take certain actions, including actions related to the guardianship of disabled persons, admission of individuals to mental health facilities, the Emergency and Allergy Treatment Program, and the Attendant Care Program; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to cover charges related to examinations by a physician assistant for certain emergency evaluees; etc.

Synopsis: Allowing certain eligible taxpayers who volunteer in certain schools in Prince George's County a credit against the State income tax in an amount equal to $20 for each volunteer hour, not to exceed $500; requiring the State Department of Education, in consultation with the Comptroller, to develop and make available a certain application and tax credit certificate; requiring a certain county board member or school administrator to issue tax credit certificates in a certain manner; making the credit refundable; etc.

Synopsis: Authorizing the Prince George's County Council and the Governing Body of Prince George's County to defer the payment of the school facilities surcharge and the public safety and behavioral health surcharge until the final inspection of the new residential construction, the issuance of a use and occupancy permit for the property, or the time of closing of the first sale of the property occurring after the issuance of the building permit.

Synopsis: Clarifying that applicants for licensure as an optometrist and certain applicants for reinstatement are required to pass all sections of each part of a licensure examination; repealing the requirement that the State Board of Examiners in Optometry give examinations to licensure applicants; prohibiting the Board from placing a licensee on inactive status for more than 6 consecutive years; etc.

Title: Honoring Charlie Kirk
Synopsis: Honoring Charles "Charlie" James Kirk.
bill_summary: This joint resolution honors the life, leadership, and legacy of Charles 'Charlie' James Kirk, the founder of Turning Point USA, following his death in 2025. The resolution condemns his assassination and all forms of political violence, commends law enforcement for their response, and calls upon all Americans to reject political extremism in favor of respectful civil discourse and the defense of constitutional principles.
responsible_party: The Maryland General Assembly and the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: The family of Charlie Kirk, Turning Point USA, law enforcement personnel, and the general public.

Title: United States of America - National Infrastructure Bank
Synopsis: Urging the U.S. Congress to pass H.R. 5356 to establish a national infrastructure bank to finance urgently needed infrastructure projects.
bill_summary: This joint resolution urges the United States Congress to pass federal legislation, specifically H.R. 5356, to establish a $5 trillion National Infrastructure Bank. The resolution highlights the critical need for infrastructure investment in Maryland, including repairs to bridges, water systems, and affordable housing, and notes that the bank would finance these projects without requiring new federal taxes.
stakeholders: Maryland residents, the United States Congress, and the Maryland Congressional Delegation

Title: Charitable Organizations - Charitable Donation and Tax-Exempt Status - Revocation (Keeping Charities Nonpartisan Act of 2026)
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain charitable organizations from participating in or intervening in a political campaign on behalf of or in opposition to a candidate for public office; authorizing the Secretary of State and the Attorney General, acting jointly, to order a 2-year revocation of certain tax-exempt statuses if a certain determination is made; requiring the Comptroller and the Director of the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to revoke certain tax-exempt statuses under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The Keeping Charities Nonpartisan Act of 2026 prohibits charitable organizations that receive tax-deductible donations from participating or intervening in political campaigns for or against candidates for public office. It authorizes the Secretary of State and the Attorney General to investigate violations, assess civil penalties of up to $5,000 per violation, and jointly order the revocation of state income, sales, and property tax exemptions for two years for willful violations. The act is contingent on changes to federal law or enforcement (the Johnson Amendment) that would otherwise allow such political activity by charities.
responsible_party: Secretary of State, Attorney General, Comptroller, and the Director of the State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Charitable organizations, donors, political candidates, and Maryland state tax authorities.

Title: Higher Education - Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship - Repeal of Termination Date
Synopsis: Repealing the prohibition on awarding the Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship after June 30, 2030; and repealing the limitation on renewing the Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship if the scholarship recipient received an initial scholarship before June 30, 2030.
bill_summary: This bill makes the Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship permanent by repealing the June 30, 2030, termination date for awarding initial scholarships and removing the limits on scholarship renewals after that date.
stakeholders: Maryland resident veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq conflicts, active service members who served in those conflicts, and their spouses and children

Title: State Highway Administration - Speed Monitoring Systems - Application Approval
Synopsis: Requiring the State Highway Administration to approve, deny, or return as incomplete an application for the use of a certain speed monitoring system within 90 days after receipt of the application; and providing that if the Administration does not approve, deny, or return the application in accordance with the Act, the application is deemed approved.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Highway Administration to approve, deny, or return as incomplete any application for a speed monitoring system on a State highway within 90 days of receipt. If the Administration fails to act within this timeframe, the application is automatically deemed approved.
stakeholders: Maryland counties, municipal corporations, and the State Highway Administration

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - License Fee Refund Requirements - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain alcoholic beverages license fee refund requirements to allow for certain members of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and the Public Health Service to be eligible for a refund of a portion of the license fee; etc.
bill_summary: This bill alters the requirements for alcoholic beverages license fee refunds to include members of the uniformed services, such as the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and the Public Health Service, who volunteer for or are called into service, allowing them to receive a refund of the unearned portion of their license fee upon surrendering the license.
responsible_party: Executive Director of the Maryland Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission and local alcoholic beverages licensing boards
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverages license holders who are members of the uniformed services, including the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and the Public Health Service, or the organized State militia.

Title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Conditional License to Practice Social Work - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Board of Social Work Examiners may issue a conditional license to practice social work; establishing alternate pathways through which an individual issued a conditional license may receive a full license; and requiring the Board, beginning in 2026, to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the number of conditional licenses issued under the program, the number of conditional license holders who obtained full licensure, and any recommendations for improving the program.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the criteria for the State Board of Social Work Examiners to issue conditional licenses for bachelor and master level social work. It establishes a new pathway for conditional licensees to obtain a full license by completing 1,500 hours of supervised work experience as an alternative to passing a standardized examination. The bill also defines the duration and supervision requirements for these conditional licenses and requires the Board to report annually on the program's outcomes.
responsible_party: State Board of Social Work Examiners
stakeholders: Applicants for bachelor and master social work licenses, Board-approved social work supervisors, and the Maryland health care workforce.

Title: Maryland Commission on Women's Health Advancement - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Commission on Women's Health Advancement to study the feasibility of establishing a State women's hospital in Southern Maryland and a statewide clinical network to advance women's health; requiring the Commission by January 1, 2027, to submit to the Governor and the General Assembly an initial action plan, including a timeline, milestones, and specific research objectives; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Commission on Women’s Health Advancement to study the feasibility of creating a State women’s hospital in Southern Maryland and a statewide clinical network for women's healthcare. The commission is responsible for analyzing health gaps, assessing financial viability, and providing recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly before it expires in 2033.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on Women’s Health Advancement, the Maryland Department of Health, and the Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Women in Maryland, healthcare professionals, patient advocates, and underserved populations

Title: Natural Resources - State Parks - Maryland Golden Age Pass
Synopsis: Establishing that the holder of a Maryland Golden Age Pass is entitled to free day-use entry at certain State parks and is authorized to launch a boat at any State park without paying a boat launch fee; altering the days of the week on which the holder of a Maryland Golden Age Pass may camp overnight in a State park at a discounted fee; and establishing that the free day-use entry applies to everyone in the vehicle with the holder of a Maryland Golden Age Pass under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill expands the benefits of the Maryland Golden Age Pass for individuals aged 62 and older by providing free day-use entry to State parks, extending this benefit to all passengers in the holder's vehicle when per-vehicle fees apply. It also waives boat launch fees and extends the half-price overnight camping discount to include Sundays through Thursdays.
stakeholders: Maryland residents aged 62 and older and their vehicle passengers

Title: Green and Renewable Energy Efficiency for Nonprofits (GREEN) Loan Program and Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Green and Renewable Energy Efficiency for Nonprofits Loan Program in the Maryland Clean Energy Center to provide financial assistance in the form of no-interest loans to nonprofit organizations for the planning, purchase, and installation of qualifying energy systems and for actions that improve energy efficiency; establishing the Green and Renewable Energy Efficiency for Nonprofits Loan Fund; authorizing the Governor to include $5,000,000 in the fiscal year 2028 budget for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Green and Renewable Energy Efficiency for Nonprofits (GREEN) Loan Program and Fund within the Maryland Clean Energy Center. The program provides no-interest loans to 501(c)(3) nonprofit organizations for the planning, purchase, and installation of renewable energy systems and for energy efficiency improvements such as HVAC repairs and window replacements.
stakeholders: 501(c)(3) nonprofit organizations in Maryland

Title: Public Utilities - Off-Grid Electricity Providers - Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting certain off-grid electricity providers from certain provisions of law; providing that a certain off-grid electricity provider is subject to certain laws concerning certificates of public convenience and necessity and certain other required approvals for the construction of a generating facility; providing that a person may not be considered to be an off-grid electricity provider under certain circumstances; and applying the Act to off-grid electricity providers that begin operations after October 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill exempts off-grid electricity providers from most state public utility laws and regulations, provided their generating facilities do not interconnect with the Maryland electric system, cross state lines, or occupy public roadways or rights-of-way. While exempt from general utility oversight, these providers must still comply with existing state laws regarding the construction of generating facilities, including requirements for certificates of public convenience and necessity.
stakeholders: Off-grid electricity providers, entities constructing electric generating facilities, and the Maryland Public Service Commission.

Title: Arbitration Reform for State Employees Act of 2026
Synopsis: Altering the collective bargaining process for certain State employees, including by requiring the selection of a neutral arbitrator to oversee all aspects of collective bargaining, establishing a process of arbitration in the event of impasse, and providing that certain decisions of a neutral arbitrator are advisory; requiring that each budget bill contain the appropriations necessary to implement all terms and conditions of employment in certain memoranda of understanding for the next ensuing fiscal year; etc.
bill_summary: The Arbitration Reform for State Employees Act of 2026 alters the collective bargaining process for Maryland State employees by requiring the selection of a neutral arbitrator and establishing procedures for binding arbitration in the event of an impasse. Crucially, the bill requires the Governor to include appropriations in the annual budget bill necessary to fund all terms and conditions of employment established in memoranda of understanding, and proposes a constitutional amendment to formalize these budgetary requirements.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland and the Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Maryland State employees, employees of State institutions of higher education, employees of the Maryland Environmental Service, and their exclusive collective bargaining representatives.

Title: Certified Public Accountants - Licensure - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering certain educational and experiential qualifications for a license to practice certified public accountancy; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the qualification requirements for obtaining a Certified Public Accountant license in Maryland by offering different combinations of education and practical work experience, including a new option for individuals with a baccalaureate degree and 4,000 hours of work experience.
stakeholders: Individuals seeking licensure as Certified Public Accountants and professional accountants in Maryland

Title: Maryland Service Animal Programs - Participant Disqualification - Revisions
Synopsis: Revising provisions related to the disqualification of a program participant from the Maryland Children's Service Animal Program or the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program; providing that a nonprofit training entity may disqualify a Program participant if the training entity determines the participant's involvement presents a direct threat to others; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the rules for disqualifying participants from the Maryland Children's Service Animal Program and the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program. It incorporates the federal definition of 'direct threat' from the Americans with Disabilities Act to clarify when a participant's involvement may be terminated due to safety risks to themselves, others, or the service animals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Children with trauma or developmental disabilities, Maryland veterans and their eligible family members, and nonprofit entities that train service dogs or provide therapy horse services.

Title: Behavioral Health - Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics and Outpatient Mental Health Centers - Reimbursement Rates
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Certified Behavioral Health Clinic Implementation and Rate Methodology in the Behavioral Health Administration; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to conduct a certain rate study of outpatient mental health centers in the State; requiring the Department to increase the Maryland Medical Assistance Program reimbursement rate for outpatient mental health centers by 3% in fiscal years 2026 and 2027; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Workgroup on Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinic Implementation and Rate Methodology to create a sustainable funding model for behavioral health clinics. It requires the Maryland Department of Health to conduct a rate study of outpatient mental health centers, convene a rate reform advisory panel, and provide at least a 3% annual reimbursement rate increase for these centers in fiscal years 2026 and 2027.
stakeholders: Certified community behavioral health clinics, outpatient mental health centers, and Maryland residents with mental health conditions.

Title: Commissioned Public Art - Artist Rights and Registration of Art
Synopsis: Prohibiting an entity from including in a contract for certain State public art a provision requiring artists to waive copyright rights; defining "public art" as that commissioned for a project that receives State funding, regardless of whether the State funding directly paid for the public art; requiring certain State public art to be registered with the Maryland State Arts Council; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: Senate Bill 41 protects the rights of artists by prohibiting contracts for state-funded public art from requiring a waiver of copyright protections or federal moral rights. It mandates that entities commissioning state public art register details of the work—including artist info, location, and type of art—with the Maryland State Arts Council.
stakeholders: Artists commissioned for state-funded public art projects and entities responsible for commissioning public art using state funding.

Title: Reduction Facilities and Veterans Service Organizations - Hydrolyzed and Soil Remains - Immunity
Synopsis: Providing that a registered reduction operator is not civilly liable for transferring and a veterans service organization is not civilly liable for receiving unclaimed hydrolyzed or soil remains of a veteran or an eligible dependent of a veteran for the purposes of disposition if acting in good faith; etc.
bill_summary: This bill provides civil immunity to registered reduction operators and veterans service organizations that act in good faith when transferring or receiving unclaimed hydrolyzed or soil remains of a veteran or an eligible dependent for the purpose of disposition.
stakeholders: Veterans, eligible dependents of veterans, registered reduction operators, and veterans service organizations

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Forfeiture of Benefits
Synopsis: Establishing that a public employee is subject to forfeiture of benefits from the State Retirement and Pension System when a public employee is found guilty of, pleads guilty to, or enters a plea of nolo contendere to a qualifying crime that is committed in the course of the performance of the public employee's duties; providing for the processes and procedures to implement a forfeiture of benefits; and providing for the processes and procedures to reverse a forfeiture of benefits.
bill_summary: This bill establishes that public employees who are members of the State Retirement and Pension System, including police officers, teachers, judges, and correctional officers, are subject to the forfeiture of their pension benefits if convicted of specific sexual offenses committed in the course of their duties. The bill outlines the procedures for the Board of Trustees to implement benefit forfeiture, allows for partial benefit payments to be awarded to dependents for alimony or child support through court orders, and provides a mechanism to reverse the forfeiture if a conviction is overturned.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Maryland public employees (members of the State Police, Law Enforcement Officers, Employees, Teachers, Correctional Officers, and Judges retirement systems), their spouses, children, and dependents

Title: Education - Interscholastic and Intramural Junior Varsity and Varsity Teams and Sports - Designation (Fairness in Girls' Sports Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain interscholastic and intramural junior varsity and varsity athletic teams or sports sponsored by certain schools to be expressly designated in a certain manner; prohibiting certain interscholastic and intramural junior varsity and varsity athletic teams or sports from including certain students; prohibiting certain entities from taking certain adverse actions against a school under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The Fairness in Girls’ Sports Act requires public high schools and certain nonpublic high schools to designate their interscholastic and intramural junior varsity and varsity athletic teams as either boys', girls', or coeducational. The bill specifically prohibits students whose biological sex is male from participating on teams designated for girls, females, or women. It also provides legal protections for schools that maintain separate teams for female students and authorizes civil actions for students who suffer harm or retaliation due to violations of these requirements.
responsible_party: Public and nonpublic high schools and state agencies with oversight of schools
stakeholders: High school students, public and nonpublic high schools, and athletic associations

Title: Public Schools - Self-Contained Special Education Classrooms - Use of Video Recording Devices
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education, beginning in the 2026-2027 school year, to install and provide notice of the use of certain video recording devices in self-contained special education classrooms, subject to certain requirements; prohibiting a county board from storing a certain video recording for more than 6 months after the recording date unless a request to view or store the video has been made; establishing certain reporting requirements in the event of an interruption of a certain video recording; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland county boards of education to install video recording devices in all self-contained special education classrooms starting in the 2026-2027 school year. It establishes specific protocols for notice, recording areas, and data retention, and restricts the use of these recordings to the investigation of complaints or reports of abuse and neglect. The bill prohibits using these recordings for employee performance monitoring and requires school boards to report annual usage data to the State Department of Education.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and county boards of education
stakeholders: Students in self-contained special education classrooms, parents and legal guardians of those students, school employees and contractors, school administrators, and law enforcement agencies.

Title: State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners - Grounds for Disciplinary Action - Restrictions
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners from suspending or revoking a license to practice veterinary medicine in the State, reprimanding or censuring a licensee, or placing a licensee on probation solely on the basis of the licensee discussing or recommending the use of cannabis or a product that contains cannabidiol on an animal for potential therapeutic effect or health supplementation purposes; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners from taking disciplinary action, such as suspending or revoking a license, solely because a veterinarian discusses or recommends the use of cannabis or cannabidiol (CBD) products for an animal's therapeutic or health supplementation purposes.
responsible_party: State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners
stakeholders: Licensed veterinarians and veterinary practitioners in Maryland

Title: Primary and Secondary Educators - Licenses and Public Profiles - Notation of Veteran Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Education to establish a process to include a notation indicating veteran status on licenses and public profiles of primary and secondary educators; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Education to establish a process for including a notation of veteran status on the licenses and public profiles of primary and secondary educators. It allows educators to voluntarily provide documentation of their veteran status and consent to having this status displayed and shared with state agencies to identify eligibility for veterans' benefits.
stakeholders: Primary and secondary educators who are veterans

Title: Transportation - Major Highway Capacity Expansion Projects and Impact Assessments (Transportation and Climate Alignment Act of 2026)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Transportation, as part of the planning and implementation of certain major highway expansion projects, to perform an impact assessment of the project and develop and implement a corresponding multimodal transportation program; requiring the Department, beginning with a certain Consolidated Transportation Program, to evaluate certain major capital projects for their impact on greenhouse gas emissions and vehicle miles traveled; etc.
bill_summary: The Transportation and Climate Alignment Act of 2026 requires the Maryland Department of Transportation to conduct impact assessments for major highway expansion projects costing over $100 million to measure greenhouse gas emissions and vehicle miles traveled. The bill mandates that the Department develop and fund multimodal transportation programs, such as transit improvements and bike paths, to offset any emissions increases from these highway projects to reach a net-zero impact. Additionally, it requires the Department to evaluate the State's Consolidated Transportation Program annually starting in fiscal year 2028 to ensure it aligns with Maryland's climate goals and prioritizes overburdened and underserved communities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and the State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Maryland residents, specifically those in overburdened and underserved communities, transit users, and people with disabilities.

Title: Manslaughter by Vehicle or Vessel - Increased Penalties (Jamari's Law)
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum period of imprisonment for a first conviction for manslaughter by vehicle or vessel from 10 years to 20 years and for a second or subsequent conviction, or having been previously convicted for certain other crimes, from 15 years to 30 years; etc.
bill_summary: This bill, known as Jamari’s Law, increases the maximum criminal penalties for manslaughter by vehicle or vessel. It doubles the maximum term of imprisonment from 10 years to 20 years for a first offense, and from 15 years to 30 years for individuals with certain prior convictions related to motor vehicle or vessel offenses.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals convicted of manslaughter by vehicle or vessel, law enforcement agencies, the Maryland court system, and the families of victims.

Title: Driver's Licenses - Driver Skills Examination - Motorcycle Safety Awareness
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to include at least five questions about motorcycle safety awareness on the driver skills examination required for the issuance of a driver's license; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to include at least five questions regarding motorcycle safety awareness on the driver's license examination. These questions must cover specific topics including motorcycle visibility, proper lane positioning, safe following distances, and crash prevention strategies.
stakeholders: Applicants for an original or higher class Maryland driver's license and motorcyclists.

Title: Education - Interjurisdictional Safe Pathways Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Interjurisdictional Safe Pathways Commission to identify, coordinate, and secure funding for safe pathways for students traveling to and from school; and requiring the Commission to report by December 1 annually to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly an assessment of funding opportunities, recommendations for infrastructure improvements, and progress in implementing interjurisdictional coordination.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Interjurisdictional Safe Pathways Commission to identify, coordinate, and secure funding for safe routes for students traveling to and from school. The Commission is tasked with inventorying current infrastructure, identifying gaps, and developing strategic plans for improvements such as sidewalks, crosswalks, and bike lanes, while also pursuing various funding sources including federal and private grants.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and the Interjurisdictional Safe Pathways Commission
stakeholders: Maryland public school students (including students with disabilities), parents, local school systems, and local management boards

Title: Election Law - Polling Place Procedures - Voting by Elderly Voters and Voters With Disabilities (Accessible and Expedited Voting Act of Maryland)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections, as part of the training program for election judges, to include instruction on best practices for assisting elderly voters and voters with disabilities; requiring the Board to establish guidelines for the local boards of election to implement a process to accommodate and expedite voting for elderly voters and voters with disabilities at each early voting center and polling place; requiring the local boards to implement the guidelines and collect feedback on the process; etc.
bill_summary: This bill, known as the Accessible and Expedited Voting Act of Maryland, requires the State Board of Elections to establish guidelines for local election boards to provide expedited voting processes for elderly individuals (age 65 and older) and voters with disabilities. These accommodations include dedicated expedited lines, priority seating, and specialized signage at early voting centers and polling places. The bill also mandates training for election judges on best practices for assisting these populations and requires local boards to collect real-time feedback and make immediate adjustments to their processes.
responsible_party: State Board of Elections and local boards of elections
stakeholders: Elderly voters (aged 65 and older) and voters with disabilities

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class A License - Food Retailers
Synopsis: Authorizing a food retailer to offer to purchase a Class A license from a Class A license holder under certain circumstances; and authorizing a food retailer to apply to a local licensing board for a Class A license under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes food retailers that meet specific size and product requirements to obtain Class A alcoholic beverage licenses. It allows these retailers to offer to purchase an existing Class A license from a holder within 3,000 feet at fair market value. If the current license holder refuses the offer, the food retailer is permitted to apply to the local licensing board for a new Class A beer or beer and wine license. The bill also provides a process for judicial review if a license holder disputes the fair market value of an offer.
stakeholders: Food retailers, existing Class A license holders, and Maryland consumers

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C (Veterans' Organization) Licenses - Membership
Synopsis: Altering membership criteria for a Class C (veterans' organization) alcoholic beverages license in Anne Arundel County by including certain members of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and the Public Health Service and repealing a requirement that members of the veterans' organization served in a war; etc.
bill_summary: This bill alters the membership criteria for a Class C (veterans’ organization) alcoholic beverages license in Anne Arundel County. It expands eligibility to include members of the uniformed services, such as the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and the Public Health Service, and removes the requirement that members must have served during a war.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Veterans’ organizations in Anne Arundel County and members of the uniformed services, including the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and the Public Health Service

Title: Public Health – Prostate–Specific Antigen Testing (Protect Our Prostate Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain providers and laboratories to provide certain written information to patients receiving prostate-specific antigen testing; and requiring clinical laboratories that administer prostate-specific antigen tests to follow certain disclosure requirements, use standard calibration for testing assays and report test results in a standard manner, make certain disclosures to ordering providers, and follow guidelines from certain organizations.
bill_summary: The Protect Our Prostate Act establishes disclosure and procedural requirements for prostate-specific antigen (PSA) testing in Maryland. The bill requires healthcare providers and clinical laboratories to provide patients with written information on how to prepare for the test to ensure accuracy, and mandates that laboratories use FDA-approved assays, standard calibration methods, and specific reporting formats while participating in clinical proficiency programs.
stakeholders: Patients undergoing prostate-specific antigen (PSA) testing, healthcare providers, and clinical laboratories.

Title: Criminal Law - Counterfeiting and Possession of Counterfeit Lease - Penalty
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person with the intent to defraud another from creating, aiding in the creation of, or possessing a counterfeit lease or rental agreement; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits a person from creating, aiding in the creation of, or possessing a counterfeit lease or rental agreement with the intent to defraud another. It establishes that counterfeiting these documents is a felony punishable by up to 10 years in prison and/or a fine of up to $1,000, while possessing such counterfeit documents is a misdemeanor punishable by up to 3 years in prison and/or a fine of up to $1,000.
stakeholders: Landlords, tenants, and the Maryland legal system

Title: Health Occupations - Grounds for Discipline - Federal and Court Actions
Synopsis: Altering the grounds for discipline by certain health occupations boards to include being disciplined by any branch of the uniformed services or the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs; and altering the grounds for discipline of a naturopathic doctor by the State Board of Physicians to include being convicted or disciplined by a court of any state or country.
bill_summary: This bill updates the grounds for disciplinary action across several Maryland health occupation boards. It allows boards to discipline licensees who have been disciplined by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs or any branch of the uniformed services, and expands disciplinary criteria for naturopathic doctors to include court-ordered discipline or convictions from any state or country.
stakeholders: Licensed health care professionals and health occupation license applicants in Maryland.

Title: General Assembly - Office Space, Services, and Equipment
Synopsis: Repealing the prohibition against a local government subsidizing a member of the General Assembly in the maintenance of office space, services, or equipment; etc.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the existing prohibition that prevents local governments, such as counties or municipal corporations, from subsidizing the office space, services, or equipment used by members of the Maryland General Assembly.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly and local government subdivisions
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland General Assembly and local government entities (municipal corporations, counties, and other political subdivisions)

Title: Property and Casualty Insurance - Parametric Insurance - Regulation
Synopsis: Establishing requirements and prohibitions for parametric insurance policies that are issued to a resident of the State or are sold, solicited, negotiated, or offered in the State; and authorizing the Maryland Insurance Commissioner to establish a pilot program to provide insurers participating in the pilot program additional opportunities to provide parametric insurance products, serve a public need, protect vulnerable populations, and advance policy goals in the State.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a regulatory framework for parametric insurance in Maryland, which is a type of insurance that pays out a predetermined benefit when a specific, objectively measurable trigger event (such as a natural disaster) occurs, regardless of actual loss. It mandates disclosure requirements for insurers, requires the filing of rates and underwriting standards with the Maryland Insurance Administration, and authorizes the Insurance Commissioner to establish a pilot program focused on providing parametric insurance to low-income households, small businesses, and public entities.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Maryland residents, property and casualty insurers, low-income and moderate-income households, small businesses, and local government units or public entities.
