Title: Sheila E. Hixson Behavioral Health Services Matching Grant Program for Service Members and Veterans - Terminology - Active Service Members
Synopsis: Altering certain terminology used in the Sheila E. Hixson Behavioral Health Services Matching Grant Program for Service Members and Veterans that refers to active service members to refer to service members.
bill_summary: This bill alters terminology within the Sheila E. Hixson Behavioral Health Services Matching Grant Program for Service Members and Veterans, specifically changing references from 'active service member' to 'service member' to ensure consistent language regarding eligibility and program goals.
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, their families (spouses, children, and stepchildren), and local nonprofit organizations that provide behavioral health services.

Title: Higher Education - Loan Repayment and Scholarships for Correctional Officers
Synopsis: Adding correctional officers as eligible recipients in the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Police Officers and Probation Agents and the Maryland Police Officers and Probation Agents Scholarship Program.
bill_summary: This bill expands the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program and the Maryland Police Officers and Probation Agents Scholarship Program to include correctional officers as eligible recipients, providing them with financial assistance for tuition and the repayment of higher education loans.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission (Office of Student Financial Assistance)
stakeholders: Current and prospective correctional officers in Maryland seeking higher education degrees or loan repayment assistance.

Title: Legislative and Congressional Redistricting and Legislative and Congressional Redistricting and Apportionment Commission (Fair Districts for Maryland Act)
Synopsis: Requiring single-member delegate districts; altering certain standards for the drawing of legislative districts; establishing standards for the drawing of congressional districts; establishing the Legislative and Congressional Redistricting and Apportionment Commission as an independent unit of State government to divide the State into certain legislative districts and congressional districts subject to certain requirements and procedures; etc.
bill_summary: This bill proposes a constitutional amendment to establish the Legislative and Congressional Redistricting and Apportionment Commission as an independent unit of state government responsible for redrawing legislative and congressional district boundaries after each decennial census. The bill mandates the division of each legislative district into three single-member delegate districts and sets strict standards for redistricting, including requirements for geographic compactness, contiguity, and the exclusion of political data or incumbent residency information. It also shifts original jurisdiction for reviewing or establishing redistricting plans to the Supreme Court of Maryland.
responsible_party: Legislative and Congressional Redistricting and Apportionment Commission
stakeholders: Maryland registered voters, political candidates, incumbent officeholders, and the general population of Maryland.

Title: Real Time for Violent Crime Act (Geri's Law)
Synopsis: Prohibiting the earning of diminution credits to reduce the term of confinement of an incarcerated individual who is serving a sentence for murder in the first degree or murder in the second degree in a State or local correctional facility; prohibiting a deduction of diminution credits of more than 10% of an incarcerated individual's aggregate sentence for crimes of violence for an incarcerated individual who is serving a sentence for a crime of violence; etc.
bill_summary: Known as Geri's Law, this bill prohibits incarcerated individuals serving sentences for first or second-degree murder from earning diminution credits to reduce their terms of confinement. It also limits the total amount of diminution credits an individual serving a sentence for a crime of violence can earn to 10% of their aggregate sentence and restricts judicial officers from authorizing pretrial release for defendants charged with crimes of violence if they have pending charges or recent prior convictions for similar offenses.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals convicted of murder or crimes of violence, defendants charged with violent crimes, and judicial officers in the Maryland court system

Title: Criminal Law – Distribution of Students’ Personal Information – Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from distributing personal identifying information or images of a student enrolled in an institution of secondary education or an institution of postsecondary education with intent or knowledge that the information will be used to harm the student or with reckless disregard for the risk the information will be used to harm the student; and providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and is subject to imprisonment of up to 1 year or a fine of up to $5,000 or both.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the intentional distribution of personal identifying information or images of students in grades 6 through 12 or postsecondary institutions without consent if done with the intent, knowledge, or reckless disregard that the information will be used to cause physical injury, serious emotional distress, or economic harm. Violations are classified as a misdemeanor punishable by up to one year in prison and/or a fine of up to $5,000.
stakeholders: Students in grades 6 through 12, students in postsecondary education, parents and guardians of minor students, and the Maryland legal system.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Residential Property Tax Payment Deferrals - Eligibility
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for property tax payment deferrals in Anne Arundel County to include members of certain reserve components and certain members of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and the Public Health Service.
bill_summary: This bill expands the eligibility for property tax payment deferrals for residential real property in Anne Arundel County. It adds members of reserve components of the military, as well as members of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and the Public Health Service, to the list of individuals eligible for these deferrals if they meet specific residency, age or disability, and income requirements.
responsible_party: Governing body of Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Homeowners in Anne Arundel County who are members of the reserve components of the armed forces, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, or the Public Health Service.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Automated Speed Enforcement - Improper Registration
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to enter into an agreement or arrangement with Virginia to obtain information regarding motor vehicles owned by Maryland residents and improperly registered in Virginia; requiring the Administration to make the information available to State and local governments for certain automated speed enforcement purposes; increasing the penalties for the owners or drivers of certain improperly registered motor vehicles for violations recorded by automated speed enforcement systems; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to enter into an agreement with the Commonwealth of Virginia to obtain information about Maryland residents who have improperly registered their vehicles in Virginia. It mandates the creation of a searchable database for State and local agencies to identify these individuals when issuing citations via speed monitoring and work zone speed control systems. Additionally, the bill establishes significantly higher civil penalties for automated speed violations for Maryland residents with improperly registered Virginia vehicles and requires citations to include notice that improper registration is a legal violation.
stakeholders: Maryland residents who improperly register their motor vehicles in Virginia; State and local law enforcement and governmental entities using automated speed enforcement systems

Title: Board of Public Works – Contract Review – Climate and Sustainability Information
Synopsis: Requiring a State agency to provide certain climate and sustainability information on submission of a contract award recommendation to the Board of Public Works for architectural and engineering service, construction, energy performance, general miscellaneous, and landlord lease and tenant lease contracts; requiring liaisons to the Board to ensure compliance; and requiring the climate and sustainability information to be placed on the Board agenda.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland State agencies to provide specific climate and sustainability information to the Board of Public Works when submitting certain types of contracts for approval, including construction, energy performance, and leasing. The information must detail how the contract contributes to greenhouse gas reduction, climate resilience, and adherence to green building standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works (specifically the liaisons from the Governor, the Comptroller, and the State Treasurer)
stakeholders: Maryland State agencies and private contractors/vendors providing architectural, engineering, construction, energy, or leasing services to the State.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Surviving Spouse of Fallen Public Safety Officer or Judicial Officer - Alteration
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or a municipal corporation to provide a certain property tax credit to surviving spouses of fallen public safety officers or judicial officers who have remarried.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes local governments in Maryland, including Baltimore City, to provide a property tax credit to the surviving spouses of fallen public safety officers or judicial officers regardless of whether the spouse has remarried.
responsible_party: Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation
stakeholders: Surviving spouses of fallen public safety officers or judicial officers who have remarried.

Title: Health Insurance - Required Benefits for Dental Preventive Care - Frequency Limitation Interval (Healthy Moms and Family Smiles Act)
Synopsis: Shortening, from 120 to 90, the maximum interval of days that certain carriers may impose as a frequency limitation on dental preventive care; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2027.
bill_summary: This bill, known as the Healthy Moms and Family Smiles Act, reduces the maximum interval that health insurance carriers can require between covered preventive dental care visits. It mandates that insurance carriers cannot impose a frequency limitation of more than 90 days (down from 120 days) between preventive services for plans that cover such services more than once a year.
stakeholders: Maryland residents with dental insurance coverage and health insurance carriers, including insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and dental plan organizations.

Title: Personal Information - Public Servant Protections
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain protected individual or the agency, entity, or office that the protected individual serves or served to request that a governmental entity or person not publish personal information on the Internet, social media, or social networks or that the governmental entity or person remove the information from any existing publication; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Public Servant Address Confidentiality Program and provides legal protections for the personal information of certain public servants, including law enforcement officers, prosecutors, and elected officials. It allows these individuals and their immediate family members to request that governmental entities and private persons remove their personal information from the internet and social media, and it authorizes the use of substitute addresses to maintain privacy in public records.
stakeholders: Protected individuals including attorneys in the Office of the Attorney General, state and federal prosecutors, current or retired law enforcement officers, federal, state, and local elected officials, and their co-habitating spouses, children, or dependents.

Title: Oversight Committee on Quality of Care in Nursing Homes and Assisted Living Facilities - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Oversight Committee on Quality of Care in Nursing Homes and Assisted Living Facilities.
bill_summary: This bill alters the membership of the Oversight Committee on Quality of Care in Nursing Homes and Assisted Living Facilities by reducing the number of members appointed from the House Health and Government Operations Committee and removing the requirement for a member from the Senate Education, Health, and Environmental Affairs Committee.
responsible_party: The Oversight Committee on Quality of Care in Nursing Homes and Assisted Living Facilities
stakeholders: Maryland General Assembly members, state executive agencies including the Department of Health and Department of Aging, nursing home and assisted living facility industry representatives, and long-term care consumer advocates.

Title: Food, Drugs, and Cosmetics - Gene Structure- and Function-Modifying Products - Labeling
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from offering for sale in the State a gene structure- or function-modifying product unless the product is labeled in a prominent and conspicuous manner with the words "gene structure- or function-modifying product" and all potential risks, side effects, adverse effects, and other reasonably possible effects that the product may have; and establishing penalties for a violation of the Act.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the sale of products produced through modern biotechnology (such as gene editing or RNA interference) that may modify the gene structure or function of a consumer unless the product is clearly labeled. The required labeling must include the specific phrase 'GENE STRUCTURE– OR FUNCTION–MODIFYING PRODUCT' and a comprehensive list of all potential health risks, side effects, and adverse effects. The bill establishes criminal and civil penalties for violations, including fines and imprisonment.
stakeholders: Consumers, manufacturers, and retailers of gene structure- or function-modifying products in Maryland

Title: Charles County - Summer Academy for Mathematics and Service Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Summer Academy for Mathematics and Service Pilot Program within the Maryland Department of Labor to provide targeted instruction in a 6-week course offered during summer break to eligible students in Charles County who are not proficient in algebra or geometry; requiring the Charles County public school system to implement the Program; and requiring the Department to provide grants to the Charles County public school system for the Program.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Summer Academy for Mathematics and Service Pilot Program in Charles County. The program provides a 6-week summer instruction course in algebra and geometry for students in grades 9 through 11 who are not proficient in mathematics. The Maryland Department of Labor is responsible for issuing standards and awarding grants, while the Charles County public school system is responsible for implementing the instruction.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Charles County public school system
stakeholders: Students in grades 9 through 11 in Charles County public schools who are not proficient in mathematics or attend schools with low mathematics proficiency

Title: Baltimore County Food Desert Study
Synopsis: Requiring, on or before November 30, 2026, the Department of Housing and Community Development to conduct a study and make recommendations on reducing food deserts in Baltimore County and submit its findings and recommendations to the Senate Committee on Education, Energy, and Environment, the Senate Finance Committee, and the House Environment and Transportation Committee.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development to conduct a study on food deserts in Baltimore County. The study will analyze the locations and impacts of food deserts, review existing funding and projects, and develop recommendations and strategies to attract grocery stores and supermarket retailers to these areas. A report of the findings is due to the General Assembly by November 30, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore County, grocery stores and supermarket retailers, and Maryland State legislative committees

Title: Domestic Violence - Warrantless Arrests and Victims
Synopsis: Authorizing a police officer to arrest a certain person without a warrant if the police officer has probable cause to believe that the person battered another person with whom the person has had a sexual relationship within the past year; and altering the definition of "victim of domestic violence" in provisions relating to a certain domestic violence program to include an individual who has received certain injuries from another individual with whom the individual has had a sexual relationship within the past year.
bill_summary: This bill expands the authority of police officers to make warrantless arrests in domestic violence cases to include situations where the suspect battered a person with whom they had a sexual relationship in the past year. It also updates the statutory definition of a victim of domestic violence to include individuals harmed by someone with whom they had a sexual relationship within the previous year.
stakeholders: Individuals who have had a sexual relationship with an aggressor within the past year and Maryland police officers

Title: Collective Bargaining - Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission - Police Officers
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law governing collective bargaining for State employees to police officers of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission who, in an official capacity, are authorized to make arrests and who are not supervisory, managerial, or confidential employees.
bill_summary: This bill extends collective bargaining rights to police officers employed by the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission who are authorized to make arrests, while excluding those who serve in supervisory, managerial, or confidential roles.
stakeholders: Police officers employed by the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission authorized to make arrests

Title: Public Works Contracts - Apprenticeship Requirements (Maryland Workforce Apprenticeship Utilization Act)
Synopsis: Altering certain apprenticeship requirements relating to public works contracts to require certain contractors and subcontractors to employ a certain number of qualified apprentices or journeyworkers necessary to meet a certain applicable percentage for the project; altering which projects are subject to certain apprenticeship requirements; repealing certain provisions of law that authorized contractors and subcontractors to make certain payments to a certain apprenticeship program in lieu of employing certain apprentices; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Workforce Apprenticeship Utilization Act modifies apprenticeship requirements for public works contracts. It requires contractors and subcontractors with four or more employees to ensure that a specific percentage of total labor hours (starting at 20% in 2027) are performed by qualified apprentices or journeyworkers. The bill also expands these requirements to include the University System of Maryland and Baltimore City Community College, removes the option for contractors to pay into a fund in lieu of hiring apprentices, and authorizes the Secretary of Labor to adjust annual apprentice utilization percentages and grant waivers in cases where apprentices are unavailable.
stakeholders: Contractors and subcontractors on public works projects, apprentices, journeyworkers, the University System of Maryland, and Baltimore City Community College

Title: Public Information Act - Personnel Records of Elected Officials and Joint Ethics Committee Records
Synopsis: Establishing that certain records of elected officials are not personnel records for the purposes of inspection under the Public Information Act; and establishing that certain records of the State Ethics Commission and Joint Committee on Legislative Ethics are available for public inspection under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill amends the Maryland Public Information Act to provide that records relating to administrative or criminal investigations of misconduct by elected officials, or persons appointed to fill an elected office, are not considered confidential personnel records and are therefore subject to public inspection. It also permits the State Ethics Commission and the Joint Committee on Legislative Ethics to allow public inspection of records once a complaint or investigation has been closed.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission and the Joint Committee on Legislative Ethics
stakeholders: Elected officials, individuals appointed to elected offices, members of the Maryland General Assembly, and the public.

Title: Notation of Veteran Status - Public Profiles
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of the Environment, the Department of General Services, and units in the Maryland Department of Labor to include a notation on public profiles of licensees, certificate holders, and security identification card holders indicating that the individual is a veteran.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Department of the Environment, the Department of General Services, the Maryland Department of Labor, and various health occupations boards to include a notation of veteran status on public profiles, professional licenses, certificates, and identification cards. It establishes a process for applicants to provide proof of their veteran status and allows them to consent to being contacted by state agencies regarding eligibility for veteran benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment, Department of General Services, Maryland Department of Labor, and Health Occupations boards
stakeholders: Veterans who are licensed professionals or state identification card holders in Maryland

Title: Income Tax - Credit for Individuals Residing With and Caring for Elderly Parents
Synopsis: Allowing a credit of $3,000 against the State income tax for an individual who resides with and provides care for a certain elderly parent during the taxable year under certain circumstances; making the credit refundable; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a $3,000 refundable state income tax credit for individuals who reside with and provide care for a parent aged 70 or older for at least six months during a taxable year, provided the individual meets specific income requirements.
stakeholders: Maryland residents who provide care for and live with a parent aged 70 or older

Title: Prince George's County - Point-to-Point Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 210
Synopsis: Authorizing the placement and use of speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Indian Head Highway) in Prince George's County, subject to certain requirements.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Prince George's County to implement point-to-point speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Indian Head Highway). These systems calculate the average speed of a vehicle between two fixed points to identify speed violations of at least 12 miles per hour above the limit. The bill establishes specific operational requirements, including segment lengths of 1 to 10 miles, required signage, and public notice, while directing net revenues toward safety studies and infrastructure improvements on Route 210.
responsible_party: Prince George's County and the Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Motorists traveling on Maryland Route 210 in Prince George's County

Title: Commercial Law - Uniform Commercial Code - Controllable Electronic Records
Synopsis: Adding Article 12 of the Uniform Commercial Code to the Maryland Uniform Commercial Code to establish provisions governing the transfer of property rights in certain controllable electronic records, controllable accounts, and controllable payment intangibles.
bill_summary: This bill updates the Maryland Uniform Commercial Code by adding Title 10A, which establishes legal frameworks and property rights for digital assets referred to as controllable electronic records, controllable accounts, and controllable payment intangibles. It defines how control of these records is established, how rights are transferred to purchasers, and the obligations of account debtors.
stakeholders: Purchasers and sellers of digital assets, account debtors, financial institutions, and legal professionals

Title: Railroads - Required Crew for Movement of Freight
Synopsis: Prohibiting a railroad train used in connection with the movement of freight from being operated in the State unless it has at least two crew members, subject to certain exceptions; providing a penalty for a first offense of up to $10,000 or in the case of a willful violation within the immediately preceding 3 years, or a fine of up to $25,000; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires freight railroad trains operating in Maryland to have a crew of at least two individuals if they share a rail corridor with high-speed passenger or commuter trains. It establishes civil penalties for violations, ranging from $10,000 to $25,000 for repeat offenses. The implementation of this law is contingent upon the enactment of similar legislation in New York, Pennsylvania, and Virginia.
stakeholders: Railroad companies, freight train crew members, and the general public.

Title: Counties - Construction of Sidewalks and Crosswalks - Safe Alternative Routes to Public Schools
Synopsis: Requiring a county board of education each year to prepare and post to the county's website a report that identifies pathways that public school students who are ineligible for transportation services may use to travel to school using only safe alternative routes under certain circumstances; requiring the governing body of a county each year to review a certain report and construct any sidewalks and crosswalks necessary to create safe alternative routes for public school students under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires county boards of education in Maryland to prepare and publish annual reports identifying safe alternative routes for public school students who live within walking distance of their assigned schools and do not receive bus transportation. It further mandates that county governing bodies review these reports and construct the necessary sidewalks and crosswalks to create these safe routes, including coordinating with other jurisdictions or entities when necessary.
responsible_party: Maryland county boards of education and county governing bodies
stakeholders: Public school students residing in areas ineligible for school transportation services

Title: Emergency Medical Services - Vehicles and Ambulances - Required Supplies, Reviews, and Complaints
Synopsis: Requiring the Executive Director of the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems to coordinate the minimum equipment, supplies, and medications to be available on emergency medical services vehicles; requiring each county and municipality that operates or contracts emergency medical services to conduct quarterly reviews of ambulance performance data; and requiring each county to establish and maintain a formal complaint filing system regarding ambulance quality, conduct, or compliance.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Executive Director of the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems (MIEMSS) to coordinate minimum standards for equipment, supplies, and medications on emergency medical services vehicles. It also mandates that counties and municipalities conducting emergency medical services perform quarterly performance reviews and requires each county to establish a formal system for receiving and investigating complaints regarding ambulance service quality and conduct.
responsible_party: Executive Director of the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Maryland residents using emergency medical services, county and municipal governments, and emergency medical service providers

Title: Natural Resources - State Park Entry Fee - Exemptions
Synopsis: Altering the individuals and vehicles that may enter a State park without paying a certain fee on presentation of a valid veteran identification card, a driver's license or other State-issued license or identification card that indicates the holder is a veteran, or any other form of identification that establishes the holder's veteran status or former Maryland National Guard status.
bill_summary: This bill expands the state park entry fee exemption to include former members of the Maryland National Guard who were discharged or released under conditions other than dishonorable. It allows these individuals and any vehicle they are traveling in to enter Maryland state parks without paying day-use or per-vehicle entry fees upon presenting an accepted entrance document, such as a veteran identification card or driver's license indicating veteran status.
stakeholders: Veterans and former members of the Maryland National Guard

Title: Criminal Procedure - Motion to Reduce Duration of Sentence - Repeal of Sentencing Date Limitation
Synopsis: Repealing the sentencing date limitation of October 1, 2021, for an individual convicted as an adult of an offense committed when the individual was a minor to file a motion to reduce the duration of the sentence.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the requirement that an individual convicted as an adult for a crime committed as a minor must have been sentenced before October 1, 2021, to be eligible to file a motion to reduce their sentence duration after serving at least 20 years. It also applies to certain individuals who committed offenses between the ages of 18 and 25, provided they meet specific criteria and have served at least 20 years.
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals who committed offenses as minors or as young adults (under 25) and crime victims or their representatives.

Title: Income Tax - Addition Modification for Federal Tax-Exempt Income - Alterations
Synopsis: Providing that an addition modification under the Maryland income tax for certain income exempt from federal tax by federal law or treaty but not State tax does not apply to certain foreign earned income; and applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the calculation of Maryland adjusted gross income by specifying that foreign earned income, as defined by the Internal Revenue Code, is not subject to the state's addition modification for income that is exempt from federal tax by law or treaty but not state tax.
stakeholders: Maryland residents with foreign earned income

Title: Shellfish Aquaculture - Penalties - Suspension or Revocation of Permit or Registration Card
Synopsis: Authorizing the suspension or revocation of a shellfish aquaculture harvester permit or shellfish aquaculture harvester registration card for certain violations; and prohibiting a person whose registration or permit card has been suspended or revoked in accordance with the Act from engaging or working in any aquaculture activity during the suspension or revocation.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to suspend for up to five years or revoke shellfish aquaculture harvester permits and registration cards for specific violations, including harvesting in prohibited areas, using illegal gear, harvesting outside of allowed times, or unauthorized harvesting from leased areas or natural oyster bars. It mandates an administrative hearing process before penalties are applied and prohibits individuals from participating in any aquaculture activity during their suspension or revocation period.
stakeholders: Shellfish aquaculture harvester permit holders, registration card holders, and commercial oyster harvesters.

Title: Department of Natural Resources - Licenses, Permits, Registrations, and Public Profiles - Notation of Veteran Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to establish a certain process to include a notation of veteran status on a license, permit, registration, or public profile.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to include a notation of veteran status on licenses, permits, registrations, and public profiles. To receive this notation, applicants must provide proof of veteran status and consent to being contacted by state agencies regarding their eligibility for veterans' benefits.
stakeholders: Maryland veterans who apply for licenses, permits, or registrations through the Department of Natural Resources

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation - Blockchain-Based Real Property Title Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Blockchain-Based Real Property Title Pilot Program in the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to explore the use of blockchain technology for securely recording and verifying real property ownership and to assess its potential for use by law enforcement and courts in resolving real property disputes involving squatting.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Blockchain-Based Real Property Title Pilot Program within the Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation. The program aims to explore the use of blockchain technology for securely recording and verifying real property ownership and to assess its potential for helping law enforcement and courts resolve disputes involving squatting. The program will be implemented in up to three pilot jurisdictions and will involve the creation of a blockchain registry where property owners can opt-in to have their titles mirrored as digital tokens.
responsible_party: State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Property owners in up to three selected Maryland counties, the Maryland Judiciary, the Maryland State Police, local law enforcement agencies, and the Office of the Attorney General.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Methodist Churches - Trust Requirement Repeal and Disaffiliation
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the assets of any Methodist Church be held in trust for the United Methodist Church and be subject to the control of the Church; repealing a provision of law providing that the absence of a trust clause in any deed or conveyance executed before June 1, 1953, does not exclude certain local churches from certain provisions of law; providing that a local church that disaffiliates from the United Methodist Conference shall retain ownership of its real property, subject to certain reimbursement requirements; etc.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the legal requirement that assets of Methodist churches in Maryland be held in trust for the United Methodist Church. It allows local churches to disaffiliate from the United Methodist Conference while retaining ownership of their real property, provided they reimburse the Conference for financial investments made toward the property's acquisition, maintenance, or improvement. The bill also requires the Conference to provide a transparent accounting of such funds to determine the reimbursement amount.
stakeholders: Local Methodist churches, church congregations, and the United Methodist Conference.

Title: State Board of Education - Enforcement Procedures - Alteration
Synopsis: Requiring an appeals process established by the State Board of Education not to exceed 90 days for appeals of actions taken by a county board of education for removal of the county superintendent or a member of the county board of education; and authorizing an extension of the appeals process if due process demands the extension or the State Board determines that an extension is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public health or safety.
bill_summary: This bill requires that any appeals process established by the State Board of Education regarding the removal of a county superintendent or a member of a county board of education must be completed within 90 days, unless an extension is necessary for due process or to preserve public health or safety.
stakeholders: County superintendents, members of county boards of education, and the Maryland State Board of Education

Title: City of Cumberland - Speed Monitoring Systems - Tractor Trailers on Interstate 68
Synopsis: Authorizing the City of Cumberland to use speed monitoring systems on portions of Interstate 68 for which the speed limit is 45 miles per hour to enforce speed limits for Class F (tractor) vehicles operated in combination with Class G (trailer) freight trailers or semitrailers.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the City of Cumberland to use speed monitoring systems on portions of Interstate 68 where the speed limit is 45 miles per hour to enforce speed limits specifically for tractor-trailers (Class F tractors in combination with Class G trailers). The revenue generated from fines, after covering administrative costs, is dedicated to public safety programs and transportation improvements within the Interstate 68 corridor in Cumberland.
stakeholders: Operators of Class F tractor and Class G trailer combinations on Interstate 68 and the general public traveling through the Interstate 68 corridor in the City of Cumberland.

Title: Criminal Law - Interference With Access to or Egress From a Religious Facility - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person, acting alone or with others, from preventing another from entering or exiting a religious facility; and establishing that a violation of the Act is a misdemeanor with a penalty of imprisonment not exceeding 90 days or a fine not exceeding $1,000 or both on conviction.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits individuals from intentionally preventing others from entering or exiting a religious facility, such as a place of worship, cemetery, or religious school, by physically detaining them or obstructing their passage. Violators are guilty of a misdemeanor and may face up to 90 days in jail, a fine of up to $1,000, or both.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and Law Enforcement Agencies
stakeholders: Religious organizations, congregants, students and staff at religious schools, and individuals visiting religious facilities.

Title: Transportation - Study on Speed Limits - Interstate 495 and Connected Highways
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Transportation to conduct a study on the implications of requiring the speed limit to deviate by only 5 miles per hour at locations where a highway in the State connects to Interstate 495; and requiring the Department to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Transportation to conduct a study on the safety and traffic implications of speed limit changes on highways that connect to Interstate 495. The Department must analyze five years of data regarding traffic congestion, accidents, and speeding violations, specifically evaluating the feasibility of limiting speed limit deviations to five miles per hour at these connection points. A report is due to the Governor and General Assembly by December 31, 2026.
stakeholders: Maryland drivers who use highways connecting to Interstate 495, local officials, and traffic safety experts

Title: Hunting - Lead and Lead-Based Ammunition - Phase-Out
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to require, through a certain phasing-out process, the use of nonlead ammunition for the hunting of all game species on or before July 1, 2029; and requiring the Department to authorize the use of lead ammunition for muzzleloaders, handguns, rifles, and shotguns if nonlead ammunition is not commercially available for the specific weapon.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to phase out the use of lead and lead-based ammunition for hunting all game species in the state by July 1, 2029. The phase-out follows a specific timeline: regulations for pen-raised birds must be adopted by July 2027; regulations for upland game birds, webless migratory birds, and wild turkeys by July 2028; and regulations for deer and all remaining game species by July 2029. The bill allows for an exception if nonlead ammunition is not commercially available for a specific weapon.
stakeholders: Hunters, venison consumers, food bank recipients, and wildlife populations

Title: Public Safety - Maryland Cyber Reserve - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Cyber Reserve within the Military Department; providing the purpose of the Maryland Cyber Reserve is to provide educational and technical support to prevent and resolve attacks against State, county, and local government agencies, and critical infrastructure within the State; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Cyber Reserve as a component of the State's organized militia within the Military Department. Its primary mission is to provide educational and technical support to prevent and resolve cyber attacks against State, county, and local government agencies, as well as critical infrastructure, corporations, and citizens within Maryland.
responsible_party: The Maryland Military Department, under the operational control of the Adjutant General
stakeholders: State, county, and local government agencies; operators of critical infrastructure; Maryland citizens; and corporations conducting business within the State

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit - Reporting Requirement
Synopsis: Altering the date, from November 30 to October 1 each year, by which the Office of the Attorney General must report on certain activities of the Office's Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit and certain activities taken by the Department of the Environment and the Department of Natural Resources in response to findings of the Unit.
bill_summary: This bill changes the annual deadline for the Office of the Attorney General to report on the activities of the Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit from November 30 to October 1. It also clarifies that the report should cover the activities of the previous fiscal year.
stakeholders: Governor, General Assembly, Department of the Environment, and Department of Natural Resources

Title: Correctional Services - Comprehensive Rehabilitative Prerelease Services - Female Incarcerated Individuals
Synopsis: Altering the required specifications for a certain prerelease facility for female incarcerated individuals; requiring the Department of General Services to direct the procurement processes for the construction of a certain prerelease facility for female incarcerated individuals; requiring the Commissioner of Correction to make gender-responsive services available to certain female incarcerated individuals; requiring the implementation of comprehensive prerelease services for certain individuals by September 1, 2026; etc.
bill_summary: This bill mandates the establishment and operation of a comprehensive rehabilitative prerelease facility for female incarcerated individuals in Baltimore City. It specifies site requirements, including a minimum of 3 acres and separation from existing correctional facilities, and outlines required facility features such as career centers and trauma-informed counseling spaces. The bill requires the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Department of General Services to implement procurement and planning processes by 2026, while ensuring that gender-responsive rehabilitative services are provided to eligible women even before the facility's construction is complete.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and Department of General Services
stakeholders: Female incarcerated individuals in Maryland who are eligible for prerelease status

Title: State Designations - State Song - "The Heart of Maryland"
Synopsis: Designating "The Heart of Maryland", written by Jayla Elise from Dorchester County for the Maryland 250 Project, as the State song.
bill_summary: This bill designates "The Heart of Maryland," written by Jayla Elise, as the official State song of Maryland, filling the vacancy left after the repeal of the previous state song in 2021.
stakeholders: The residents of Maryland

Title: Washington County - Sales and Use Tax Exemption - Target Redevelopment Area
Synopsis: Providing an exemption from the sales and use tax for certain construction material or warehousing equipment that is purchased for use in the Mount Aetna Technology Park in Washington County.
bill_summary: This bill provides a sales and use tax exemption for construction materials and warehousing equipment purchased for use within the Mount Aetna Technology Park, a target redevelopment area in Washington County. The exemption is effective for 10 years, starting July 1, 2026, and ending June 30, 2036.
stakeholders: Businesses, developers, and property owners in the Mount Aetna Technology Park in Washington County

Title: Income and Property Tax Incentives - Members and Veterans of the Space Force - Application
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law relating to the job creation tax credit and certain property tax credits and exemptions for certain members, veterans, and surviving spouses of certain members and veterans of the military, naval, or air service to certain members, veterans, and surviving spouses of certain members and veterans of the space force.
bill_summary: This bill expands the eligibility for several Maryland tax incentives, specifically the job creation tax credit and certain property tax credits and exemptions, to include members, veterans, and surviving spouses of the United States Space Force.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Members, veterans, and surviving spouses of the United States Space Force

Title: Motorcycles - Protective Headgear Requirement - Exception (In Remembrance of Gary "Pappy" Boward)
Synopsis: Establishing an exception to the prohibition against operating or riding on a motorcycle without certain protective headgear for an individual at least 21 years old who has been licensed to operate a motorcycle for at least 2 years or has completed a certain motorcycle safety course and for the individual's passenger.
bill_summary: This bill establishes an exception to the Maryland law requiring motorcycle operators and passengers to wear protective headgear. To qualify for the exception, an individual must be at least 21 years old and either have held a motorcycle license for at least two years or have completed an approved motorcycle safety course. The exception also extends to passengers of operators who meet these criteria.
stakeholders: Motorcycle operators and passengers in Maryland who are at least 21 years old and meet specific licensing or safety training requirements.

Title: Prince George's Community College - Aerospace Technology Studies Program
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Community College Trustees for Prince George's County, in consultation with the Maryland Higher Education Commission, the Department of Commerce, and the Prince George's County Economic Development Corporation, to establish an Aerospace Technology Studies Program at Prince George's Community College; requiring the program to provide workforce-based learning, including internships and apprenticeships and a pathway from high school to college to careers in aerospace technology; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Board of Community College Trustees for Prince George's County to establish an Aerospace Technology Studies Program at Prince George's Community College. The program, developed in consultation with state and county economic agencies, will offer a curriculum covering aerospace systems, avionics, advanced manufacturing, and artificial intelligence. It is designed to provide workforce-based learning such as internships and apprenticeships, creating a clear career pathway from high school through college for individuals entering the aerospace technology field.
responsible_party: Board of Community College Trustees for Prince George's County
stakeholders: Prince George's Community College students, high school students interested in aerospace careers, and aerospace and technology employers in Prince George's County

Title: Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund - Eligible Companions
Synopsis: Requiring a grant from the Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund to provide opportunities to participate in certain water-dependent activities for eligible companions of individuals with disabilities or service-disabled veterans.
bill_summary: This bill expands the scope of the Individuals With Disabilities and Service–Disabled Veterans Boating Fund to include 'eligible companions' of individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans. It defines an eligible companion as a family member or direct support professional and allows the Maryland Department of Disabilities to provide grants of up to $40,000 per fiscal year to qualifying nonprofit organizations that provide water-dependent recreational opportunities, such as sailing, kayaking, and surfing, for these groups.
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, service-disabled veterans, family members, direct support professionals, and nonprofit organizations providing recreational boating activities.

Title: Police Discipline - Order to Show Cause
Synopsis: Authorizing a police officer who is denied a certain right to apply to the circuit court at any time before a hearing is held by the hearing board for an order that directs the law enforcement agency to show cause why the right should not be granted.
bill_summary: This bill allows a police officer who has been denied a right during disciplinary proceedings to apply to a circuit court for an order requiring their law enforcement agency to justify why that right should not be granted.
responsible_party: Maryland circuit courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Police officers and law enforcement agencies in Maryland

Title: Prince George's County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 210 - Penalties
Synopsis: Authorizing under certain circumstances and requiring under certain circumstances the Motor Vehicle Administration to suspend the registration of motor vehicles involved in violations recorded by a speed monitoring system placed on Maryland Route 210 (Indian Head Highway) in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes and, in certain cases, requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to suspend the registration of motor vehicles that have unpaid or uncontested speed monitoring system citations recorded on Maryland Route 210 (Indian Head Highway) in Prince George’s County. It establishes specific triggers for mandatory suspension, such as accruing three overdue citations within a 90-day period or totaling at least $500 in unpaid penalties, and mandates annual reporting by the Administration on these enforcement actions.
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners with speed monitoring system violations on Maryland Route 210 in Prince George's County

Title: Department of Natural Resources - Savage Highlands State Park - Hotel Rental Surcharge
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to assess and collect an 8% hotel rental surcharge on rental units at Savage Highlands State Park and remit the proceeds to the Comptroller for distribution to Garrett County; and requiring Garrett County to use and distribute the proceeds from the surcharge either for promotion of the county or for the general fund of the county.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Department of Natural Resources to assess and collect an 8% hotel rental surcharge on rental units located at Savage Highlands State Park. The proceeds from this surcharge are to be distributed to Garrett County, which must use a portion corresponding to a 6% rate for county promotion and the remaining portion for its general fund.
stakeholders: Garrett County government, visitors staying at rental units in Savage Highlands State Park, and the Department of Natural Resources

Title: Maryland Estate Tax - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Maryland estate tax; and applying the Act to decedents dying after June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the Maryland estate tax in its entirety, effective July 1, 2026. The repeal applies to the estates of decedents dying after June 30, 2026.
stakeholders: Maryland residents, estates of decedents dying after June 30, 2026, and their heirs

Title: Veterans and Uniformed Services - Maryland Veterans Trust Fund and Application of Laws
Synopsis: Altering the application of certain provisions of law governing local government personnel, trout stamps, and landlord remedies to apply to all uniformed services; and altering the composition of the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund.
bill_summary: This bill updates various Maryland laws to expand the definition of eligible service members from 'armed forces' to 'uniformed services', broadening eligibility for benefits such as high school diplomas for veterans of certain conflicts, local government employment credits, and trout stamp exemptions. It also updates military protection order definitions, modifies landlord-tenant remedies for active service members, and expands the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund's revenue sources to include fees from special registration plates for high-level non-combat-related uniformed services medals.
stakeholders: Veterans, active-duty members of the uniformed services, and residents serving in the uniformed services

Title: Criminal Law - Child Pornography - Prohibitions and Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from possessing more than 100 images of certain child pornography or possessing or viewing images of certain child pornography depicting a minor or an individual indistinguishable from an actual and identifiable child under the age of 13 years; providing that a violation of the Act is a felony and on conviction a violator is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 10 years; and providing that a sentence under the Act may be separate from and consecutive to or concurrent with a sentence imposed for certain other crimes.
bill_summary: This bill establishes enhanced criminal prohibitions and penalties related to child pornography, specifically targeting the possession or viewing of 100 or more images or images depicting children under the age of 13. It also defines how images are counted, stipulating that each video or film is equivalent to 20 images for the purpose of sentencing.
responsible_party: Maryland law enforcement agencies and the state judicial system
stakeholders: Minors protected under the law and individuals prosecuted for child pornography offenses

Title: Environment - Interjurisdictional Watersheds - Flood Management
Synopsis: Providing for the designation of the Carroll Creek, Gwynns Falls, Jones Falls, Herring Run, and Patapsco River watersheds as interjurisdictional flood hazard watersheds for certain planning purposes.
bill_summary: This bill designates Carroll Creek, Gwynns Falls, Jones Falls, Herring Run, and the Patapsco River as interjurisdictional flood hazard watersheds. It requires that flood management plans for these specific watersheds be reviewed and approved by the Maryland Department of the Environment as a single unified plan to ensure coordinated flood management and safety standards across the multiple jurisdictions these watersheds span.
stakeholders: Local governments and residents in Baltimore City, Baltimore County, Frederick City, Frederick County, Howard County, Carroll County, and Anne Arundel County

Title: Motor Vehicles – Parking – Disabled Veteran Special Registration Plates
Synopsis: Prohibiting a political subdivision from adopting or enforcing an ordinance, a regulation, or a policy that requires payment of a fee for parking a motor vehicle in an on-street parking space served by a meter if the vehicle has disabled veteran special registration plates; and prohibiting a State agency from adopting or enforcing a regulation or a policy that requires payment of a fee for parking a motor vehicle in a parking lot owned or controlled by the agency if the vehicle has disabled veteran special registration plates.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits Maryland political subdivisions and State agencies from charging parking fees to motor vehicles displaying disabled veteran special registration plates. Specifically, it bans fees for on-street metered parking and parking in State-owned or controlled lots for these vehicles.
responsible_party: Maryland State agencies and political subdivisions
stakeholders: Disabled veterans with special registration plates

Title: State Procurement - Preferences - Historically Underutilized Business Zone Businesses
Synopsis: Requiring a unit to structure procurement procedures to meet certain federal procurement standards; establishing certain overall percentage goals of the unit's total dollar value of procurement contracts to be made directly or indirectly with historically underutilized business zone businesses in certain years; requiring the Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to adopt regulations establishing a certification process and a percentage price preference; and establishing penalties for certain violations.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland state agencies to prioritize procurement contracts with historically underutilized business zone (HUBZone) businesses. It establishes annual participation goals for state contracts, starting at 1% in 2026 and reaching 3% by 2029, and mandates that the Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs create certification and reporting procedures. The bill also establishes criminal and civil penalties for businesses that fraudulently claim HUBZone status to obtain state contracts.
responsible_party: Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs
stakeholders: Historically underutilized business zone (HUBZone) businesses in Maryland

Title: Business Regulation - Cemeteries - Actions for Sale, Transfer, or Alternate Use
Synopsis: Authorizing certain persons to bring an action when the owner of a property that includes a cemetery proposes the sale, transfer, or alternate use of all or part of a certain cemetery; providing the owner of the property that includes the cemetery has the burden of proof in any proceeding regarding the disposition of the property and the cemetery; and requiring a court to take certain actions under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill establishes legal procedures for the sale, transfer, or alternate use of property containing a cemetery. It allows descendants, community organizations, and preservation nonprofits to challenge such changes in court, shifting the burden of proof to the property owner and authorizing courts to prohibit sales or mandate transfers to preservation-focused groups.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and the Office of Cemetery Oversight
stakeholders: Property owners, descendants of the interred, descendant community organizations, cemetery preservation nonprofits, and governmental units

Title: Business Regulation - Abandoned Cemeteries - Acquisition and Disposition
Synopsis: Authorizing a governmental unit to acquire property on which an abandoned cemetery is located under certain circumstances and for a certain purpose; requiring a governmental unit that acquires property under the Act to make a timely and reasonable effort to contact descendants of the persons interred in the abandoned cemetery for a certain purpose; authorizing a person or organization to bring an action to request the court to transfer property acquired under the Act to the person or organization; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Maryland governmental units to acquire abandoned cemeteries through condemnation for the purpose of transferring the property to descendants, descendant community organizations, or nonprofit organizations. The bill requires governmental units to make reasonable efforts to contact descendants for potential transfer and mandates that the entity receiving the property must maintain and preserve the cemetery. If a transfer cannot be completed, the governmental unit is responsible for maintaining the cemetery or may facilitate the reinterment of remains to an operational cemetery.
responsible_party: Governmental units of the State of Maryland
stakeholders: Descendants of deceased persons interred in abandoned cemeteries, descendant community organizations, and nonprofit organizations

Title: Election Law - Certification of Election-Supporting Technology - Regulations, Review, and Evaluation
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections to adopt regulations for the review, certification, and decertification of election-supporting technology and to review and evaluate election-supporting technology on or before January 1 each year; and requiring that the regulations be adopted by December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Board of Elections to adopt regulations for the review, certification, and decertification of election-supporting technology, which includes electronic pollbooks and audit tools compatible with ranked-choice voting. It also mandates that the State Board perform an annual review and evaluation of this technology starting in 2027.
stakeholders: Maryland State Board of Elections, local election boards, election technology vendors, and Maryland voters

Title: Office of Health Care Quality Stakeholder Advisory Council - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of Health Care Quality Stakeholder Advisory Council to provide feedback to the Office of Health Care Quality regarding maintaining oversight of health care facilities and to notify the Secretary of Health if the Office is negligent in providing oversight of health care facilities; and requiring the Advisory Council, beginning in 2027, and by December 1 annually, to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Office of Health Care Quality Stakeholder Advisory Council. The council is tasked with providing feedback to the Office of Health Care Quality regarding its oversight of health care facilities and notifying the Secretary of Health of any negligence in that oversight. It requires the council to hold biannual public meetings to review data on hospital monitoring, nursing home inspections, and complaint resolutions, and to submit an annual report of findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly.
stakeholders: Hospital and nursing home workers, residents of nursing homes and their families, health care facility operators, advocacy groups for individuals with disabilities or behavioral health needs, and the general public.

Title: Modernizing Civil Relief for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Authorizing active service members and spouses, under certain circumstances, to practice in the State under an occupational or professional license issued in another jurisdiction; and altering the definition of "eligible veteran" for purposes of certain provisions of law governing occupational or professional licensing processes to include former service members who have been discharged for more than 1 year before an application for a license, certificate, or registration is submitted.
bill_summary: The Modernizing Civil Relief for Service Members Act authorizes active duty service members and their spouses who relocate to Maryland under military orders to practice their profession or occupation in the state using an existing license from another jurisdiction. It establishes a process where eligible individuals can submit an application and affidavit to the relevant state licensing authority to practice for the duration of their orders. Additionally, the bill removes the one-year time limit for veterans to qualify as 'eligible veterans' for certain expedited licensing processes.
responsible_party: Maryland State agencies and licensing authorities responsible for occupational and professional licensing
stakeholders: Active duty service members, spouses of active service members, and military veterans

Title: Uniformed Services Spouses Act
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law regarding priority registration at public institutions of higher education, resources and support at community colleges, senatorial and Delegate scholarships, and preferences in hiring by the Public Service Commission to the spouses of active service members and veterans; etc.
bill_summary: The Uniformed Services Spouses Act expands several benefits previously reserved for active duty military members and veterans to their spouses. These benefits include priority course registration at public colleges and universities, specialized advising and campus resource centers at community colleges, and eligibility for Senatorial and Delegate scholarships for out-of-state study. Additionally, the bill provides hiring and promotion preferences for spouses of service members in both the private sector and the Public Service Commission, and expands the eligibility criteria for veterans to include those with an 'other than dishonorable' discharge.
responsible_party: Maryland public institutions of higher education, the Public Service Commission, and the Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Active duty service members, veterans, and the spouses of active duty service members and veterans

Title: Code Revision - Health - Maryland Medical Assistance Program
Synopsis: Revising, restating, and recodifying the laws of this State relating to the Maryland Medical Assistance Program.
bill_summary: This bill is a code revision measure that reorganizes, restructures, and updates the terminology of laws relating to the Maryland Medical Assistance Program (Medicaid) and the Maryland Children's Health Program (MCHP). It renumbers existing sections of the Health - General Article, clarifies language, and replaces outdated terms like "substance abuse" with "substance use disorder" while maintaining the existing legal requirements and benefits of the programs without making substantive changes to the law.
stakeholders: Low-income and medically indigent individuals, children, pregnant women, legal immigrants, former foster care youth, and healthcare providers including managed care organizations.

Title: Public Safety - Immigration Enforcement Agreements - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State, a unit of local government, a county sheriff, or any agency, officer, employee, or agent of the State or a unit of local government from entering into an immigration enforcement agreement; and requiring the termination of an existing immigration enforcement agreement on or before July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits Maryland state and local government entities, including law enforcement agencies and county sheriffs, from entering into agreements with the federal government to enforce civil immigration laws. Additionally, it mandates that any existing immigration enforcement agreements be terminated by July 1, 2026.
responsible_party: State and local government agencies, county sheriffs, and state/local officers and employees
stakeholders: State and local government agencies, law enforcement personnel, and immigrant populations in Maryland

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Term of Office of Members
Synopsis: Authorizing a member of the Health Services Cost Review Commission to continue to serve for a period not to exceed 6 months after the expiration of the member's term of office, rather than until a successor is appointed and qualifies; and repealing the authority of a member of the Commission who was appointed after a term began to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the term of office rules for members of the Health Services Cost Review Commission by limiting the time a member can continue to serve after their term expires to a maximum of six months. It also removes the provision that allowed members appointed after a term has begun to remain in office until a successor is appointed and qualified.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland and the Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Members of the Health Services Cost Review Commission and the Governor of Maryland

Title: Biotechnology Investment Incentive Tax Credit - Conversion to Grant Program
Synopsis: Converting the Biotechnology Investment Incentive Tax Credit to be the Biotechnology Investment Incentive Grant Program in the Department of Commerce; requiring the Department to disburse a grant within a certain time period; allowing a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for certain grants received during the taxable year; establishing a Biotechnology Investment Incentive Grant Program Fund; authorizing the Governor to include $10,000,000 in the annual budget bill for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: This bill converts the existing Biotechnology Investment Incentive Tax Credit into the Biotechnology Investment Incentive Grant Program administered by the Department of Commerce. It establishes a special, nonlapsing Biotechnology Investment Incentive Grant Program Fund and mandates an annual $10,000,000 appropriation by the Governor. The program provides cash grants to qualified individuals or entities that invest at least $25,000 in qualified early-stage Maryland biotechnology companies, and these grants are exempt from Maryland state income tax.
stakeholders: Qualified investors and Maryland-based biotechnology companies with fewer than 50 employees

Title: Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Investments - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to adopt certain regulations regarding the consideration of remedies for investments in certain businesses that no longer meet the definition of a qualified business for purposes of provisions of law governing the Corporation; authorizing, rather than requiring, the Corporation to divest itself of an interest under certain circumstances; and authorizing the Corporation to pursue certain other remedies under those circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Technology Development Corporation (TEDCO) to adopt regulations for handling investments in businesses that no longer meet the definition of a qualified business. It also changes the mandatory requirement that TEDCO divest from an equity investment within 15 years to a discretionary authority, allowing the corporation to either divest or pursue other remedies upon approval by its investment committee.
stakeholders: Qualified businesses receiving investments from TEDCO, TEDCO investment committee members, and the Maryland State government.

Title: Tobacco Product Licensees - Additional Licensure for Electronic Smoking Devices
Synopsis: Repealing a provision of law authorizing a person holding a certain license relating to cigarettes or other tobacco products to manufacture, distribute, or sell electronic smoking devices in the same capacity as a person holding a certain license relating to electronic smoking devices; exempting the holder of a certain license who is an applicant for a license to act as an electronic smoking devices retailer or vape shop vendor from the requirement to pay an additional license fee for the license; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires individuals or businesses licensed to sell or manufacture cigarettes and other tobacco products to obtain a separate license specifically for electronic smoking devices. It also exempts these existing tobacco licensees from paying the additional license fee when applying to be electronic smoking device retailers or vape shop vendors.
stakeholders: Tobacco product manufacturers, wholesalers, and retailers; electronic smoking device manufacturers, wholesalers, and retailers; and vape shop vendors.

Title: Civil Actions - Maryland Uniform Public Expression Protection Act
Synopsis: Repealing a certain provision relating to strategic lawsuits against public participation; authorizing a person served with a pleading asserting a certain cause of action based on the person's communication related to a governmental proceeding or exercise of certain constitutional rights to file a special motion for expedited relief to dismiss the cause of action; generally relating to civil actions and public expression; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Uniform Public Expression Protection Act to replace existing anti-SLAPP suit provisions. It permits individuals to file special motions for expedited dismissal of civil lawsuits targeting their exercise of constitutional rights, such as free speech or petitioning the government. The act establishes procedures for staying proceedings, mandates timelines for judicial rulings, and provides for the recovery of attorney's fees and court costs.
stakeholders: Individuals and entities involved in civil litigation regarding protected speech, assembly, or governmental communications

Title: Baltimore County Public Library - Collective Bargaining - Supervisory Employees
Synopsis: Authorizing supervisory employees of the Baltimore County Public Library to form, join, and participate in an employee organization and engage in certain other activities related to collective bargaining; authorizing certain bargaining units for the employees of the Baltimore County Public Library; and altering certain provisions to provide that an employee may be deemed a certain management employee, rather than a supervisory employee, under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes supervisory employees of the Baltimore County Public Library to form, join, and participate in employee organizations for collective bargaining. It establishes that there may be up to two bargaining units—one for supervisory employees and one for non-supervisory employees—and updates legal definitions to distinguish management employees from supervisory employees.
stakeholders: Supervisory and non-supervisory employees of the Baltimore County Public Library

Title: State Board of Professional Landscape Architects - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the name of the State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects to be the State Board of Professional Landscape Architects; altering the definition of "licensed landscape architects" to be "professional landscape architects"; altering certain qualifications for membership on the Board; altering certain duties of the Board; altering certain educational and experience requirements of applicants for a license to practice landscape architecture; etc.
bill_summary: This bill renames the State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects to the State Board of Professional Landscape Architects and updates related terminology. It modifies the qualifications for Board membership, updates educational and experience requirements for licensure applicants, authorizes the issuance of an emeritus status license for retired professionals, and adjusts administrative processes concerning license renewals, fees, and examination administration.
responsible_party: State Board of Professional Landscape Architects
stakeholders: Current and aspiring professional landscape architects, landscape architecture firms, and the Maryland Department of Labor

Title: Mel Noland Woodland Incentives and Fellowship Fund - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to include in an annual report to certain committees of the General Assembly the amount of proceeds from a certain agricultural land transfer tax that are attributable to the taxation of certain instruments of writing that transfer title to parcels of land that are entirely woodland that were distributed to the Mel Noland Woodland Incentives and Fellowship Fund during the immediately preceding fiscal year; and requiring the Department to report any uncertainties regarding certain amounts.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Places of Public Accommodation - Open Movie Captioning
Synopsis: Decreasing from eight to four the number of screens in a motion picture house above which the motion picture house is required to provide open movie captioning.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Maryland Money Transmission Act - Definition of Money Transmitter - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering, for a certain licensing requirement, the definition of "money transmitter" under the Maryland Money Transmission Act to exclude a certain person designated as an agent of a payor for the purpose of the agent's provision of payroll processing services under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification for Classroom Supplies Purchased by Teachers - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for unreimbursed expenses paid or incurred by certain teachers during a taxable year for the purchase of certain classroom supplies to include full-time teachers employed in prekindergarten programs in the State; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Community Solar Energy Generating Systems - Prohibited Locations - Adjacent Parcels
Synopsis: Repealing certain prohibitions on the location of a community solar energy generating system based on the combined installed capacity of all community solar energy generating systems on adjacent parcels of land.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Land Use - Residential Housing - Oversight, Regulation, and Taxation (Building Affordably in My Back Yard Act)
Synopsis: Establishing certain policies and processes to facilitate the development of residential housing in the State; requiring an entity that owns residential real property in the State to make a certain certification to the Department of Housing and Community Development; authorizing a local jurisdiction to establish an administrative process to review, approve, modify, or deny certain housing development project applications; requiring the Governor to establish certain housing production targets at certain intervals; etc.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Courts and Judicial Proceedings - Evidence - Rebuttable Presumption of Medical Bills
Synopsis: Establishing a rebuttable presumption in an action for personal injury or wrongful death that a medical bill from a health care provider or an agent of the health care provider is authentic, fair, and reasonable if the bill was properly provided in discovery; and establishing that a party may overcome the presumption that a medical bill is authentic, fair, and reasonable by proving, by a preponderance of the evidence, that the medical bill, or any charge in a medical bill, is not authentic, is unfair, or is unreasonable.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Public Service Commission - Full Costs and Benefits Analysis of Sources of Electricity Generation
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to conduct an analysis of the full costs and benefits of sources of electricity generation in the State; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Senate Committee on Education, Energy, and the Environment and the House Environment and Transportation Committee by December 1, 2027.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Retirement Income of Fire, Rescue, and Emergency Services Personnel - Eligibility
Synopsis: Altering a certain subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax to include certain retirement income attributable to a resident's employment with the District of Columbia as a member of a fire, rescue, or emergency services organization; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Health Insurance - Scalp Cooling Systems - Required Coverage
Synopsis: Requiring certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and managed care organizations that provide coverage for chemotherapy to treat cancer to provide coverage for scalp cooling systems used for the preservation of hair in connection with chemotherapy treatment; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2027.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Fair Housing and Housing Discrimination - Regulations, Intent, and Discriminatory Effect
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Housing and Community Development to adopt certain regulations related to affirmatively furthering fair housing; providing that certain discriminatory housing practices may be committed without intent; prohibiting a person from acting in a certain manner that has a discriminatory effect; and providing that certain conduct necessary to achieve certain nondiscriminatory interests does not constitute a certain violation.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
stakeholders: N/A

Title: Vehicle Laws - Electric Vehicle Dealer Licenses - City of Bowie
Synopsis: Increasing from four to five the number of dealer licenses available for certain manufacturers or distributors that deal only in electric or nonfossil-fuel burning vehicles; and providing that one of the licenses may be issued only for the operation of a dealership in the City of Bowie.
bill_summary: No text available to analyze.
